1152.content:
You looked over your duffle bag once more. Tomorrow was the day you made the jump to this other world. A place full of macro anthromorphic Pokemon. It scared you a bit knowing that you were going to be somewhere with only Pokemon that were bigger than you, but the girl you were supposed to stay with had made you feel a little less nervous about the whole thing. “Hey Roy, are you there?” ‘Speaking of her…’ You thought as you replied with a pathetic yes.

You walk over to the computer and see Serene, the Espeon you were going to stay with. The name fit her personality perfectly and went so well with her looks. Her blue fur was absolutely gorgeous and looked so soft. You first would look at her adorable ears and would follow them back to her head, then to her forehead. The red orb on her forehead you found cool and you really wanted to touch it, at least once. Then your eyes would shift to her long, silky light blue hair that fell to her shoulders. She had a great figure, with what looked to be a pair of D’s, but you never really cared. You were always more focused on her face or that double-ended tail of hers.

She always was waving it to where you could see, almost as if she did it intentionally to get your attention. She would occasionally walk to move around. She moved with such grace and coordination. Serene was always nice and never seemed to get angry. Her voice was always so calm that it helped you relax, even if you were already relaxed. Overall she seemed perfect, even after talking to her for months.

At first you talked to her through messages, because you were a bit timid. But as you warmed up to her, you slowly started talking to her via video chatroom. Over the course of a few months, you had become excellent friends with her, even with your shy personality. You had even thought about asking her to go out with you at one point, but quickly got rid of that thought as she was probably way out of your league, not to mention size. “Hi Serene.” You said as you took a seat. “Roy, why are you still so nervous? You know I won’t hurt you.”

It got a bit depressing knowing she could tell how you felt, but at least she wasn’t abusing that ability. “It’s not you I’m worried about. It’s everybody else. I’m small enough that they could take me out with a single hit.” “I won’t let anyone get close to you or even let them try and hurt you.” “Thanks Serene, but what about your family? They’re going to be a lot closer than anyone at school and they’re related to you.” “I don’t think they’d try and hurt you. Besides their nice for the most part.” “If you say so. I just hope they’re as nice as you.” It looked as if she blushed a bit, but it was hard to tell. “Well I’d thought I’d let you know that I will probably be doing most of the talking for you, since we both know that’s not your specialty.”

You laid back and breathed a sigh of relief. You had a hard time with talking to people and others often thought it was just you being rude. This had to be a dream, you would be staying with a girl as nice as Serene and she would help you out. It seemed too perfect to be real. “Thank you so much Serene.” “No problem Roy. I can’t wait to see you tomorrow.” You didn’t say anything, but you nodded your head and you blushed a bit. You never had a girl actually wanting to see you and that struck you as a bit foreign. “Can’t wait to see you either” You said and you both shut the E-Net off. You checked your bag once more and when you were sure you had everything, you laid down for the night.

The next morning you had gotten up early, thanks to your alarm, and got in the shower. You had told your friends goodbye last night and your family goodbye this morning. Afterwards, you had a big breakfast and waited for your ride to come and get you. What pulled up was a mid-size pick up truck. “You are Mr. Roy, correct?” You nodded and threw your bags in the bed. He drove off and the whole way you wondered why it was a truck that came and got you. Was it to attract little attention? Did they not feel like paying for a limo? Regardless, you sat there and shifted from thinking about the vehicle to thinking about Serene.

She was going to be huge, but how huge? And what about everyone else, were they going to be kind or jerks? You started to panic a bit at all the talking you would have to do, even if Serene would help you out a bit. You eventually reached the site of the dimensional gate, got out of the truck and grabbed your bags. As soon as you got out of truck, seven men in black suits stood around you and escorted you in to a room with the gate. The men left and a scientist walked in. “It is good to see you, Mr. Roy. Are you ready?” You nod and he fires up the portal. You took in one deep breath and ran through the gateway.

You looked around a few seconds later and see that you have made it. The grass was about to your waist, but you walked through it with ease. That’s when you look ahead and see a blue object in the grass. You walk over to it and notice it’s soft and has three parts, one part being a lot longer than the other two. “What is this thing?” You ask yourself as you start stroking it. Whatever it was moved a bit, then returned to staying still. You were about to stroke it again, but something lifted you in the air. You felt nothing grab you and you started to flail about. You still had your duffle bag in one hand and that’s when you noticed both you and the bag were coated in some pinkish glow. Then you remembered the time Serene showed you how she made things levitate and the object had the same glow.

Confirming your suspicions, you looked up to see a huge face looking at you. When you were about eye level, the glow faded away and you were caught in large hands. You looked at all of her and said nothing. She was pretty big and that left you stunned. “Hi Roy” Serene said. Her voice seemed a little deeper and louder, but it really didn’t change that much. “H-Hi Serene” You stuttered out. “Is my size intimidating you?” She asked. “K-Kinda, but it’s more the shock of your beauty from this size.” You said, trying not to let the fear mess with you. “Thanks” She said as she started to pet your little head.

It soothed you and you almost wanted to sit down. “I-It’s nice to see you in person.” You said. “As it is you” she responded. Her fur felt just as soft as you imagined and it was such a beautiful blue too. You sat there before she stood up, with you still in her hand. “Are you ready to go my home?” Serene asked as she looked at you with her big eyes. You nodded and were once again floating. She set you down on her head and she began walking presumably home.

11521.content:
She walked home and the whole way you looked at your surroundings. It seemed so strange to be in a place with things larger than you and filled with anthro pokemon. It just didn’t seem like a city without the cars, but there weren’t cars anywhere in this world. You had to admit, though, it was pretty nice not having somebody speed right by you. Eventually she got to a house that was massive (no pun intended). “Here we are.” “It’s amazing, but why does it seem so big?” “Assuming you mean from my point of view, it’s big because my family is so big.” You remembered how she told you about her three sisters, three brothers, and her parents.

They all managed to live in this house. “So how do you all fit?” “Well luckily we each get our own room. My parents have their room, poor Andrew has to stay in the basement, and everyone else gets their own room.” “Who’s Andrew?” “I never did tell you who was who, did I? Forgive me for that. Andrew is my twin and he is an Umbreon.” “I forgive you, but why doesn’t he have a room?” “Well everybody wanted their own room and whoever didn’t get one had to make the basement their room. None of us were willing to give up a room and it drove our parents crazy.

Finally he said he would take it.” “How did you guys get a place with so many rooms? It seems so expensive.” “It is, but that’s part of the reason why we signed up for taking you in, so we could get a better home. The other reason is because I wanted to see if you were as cute as I thought, and I was right.” You lowered your head onto hers and sighed. She again managed to embarrass you. She walked in the front door and headed towards some stairs. She went up them and to a bedroom with pink walls. You assumed this was her room and looked at everything it contained.

There was a pink bed to match the walls, a standing mirror, and some various plushes lying on the floor. She also had a desk with various things scattered on its surface, one of which being a laptop and what looked to be a model house. “So you know whose room this is, good” she said as she shut the door behind her. She obviously knew that from sensing your emotions. That was one thing about her you were glad about: She could only read emotions, not your mind. “Well welcome to my humble abode, even if it is just a part of this house.”

She walked over to the desk and grabbed you in her hands. She set you down by the house and opened the door for you. You walked in and saw that it was made for someone about your size. It was only a single story, but that was more than enough for you. “And that is your domain” she said as she peered in a window. She startled you, but you looked around the house until you found a bedroom. There was a bed and a dresser with a mirror. You set your bag down and began putting everything away.

When everything had a spot, you walked back out to see Serene waiting for you. “Thank you. It’s great.” “Your welcome, but isn’t there something you want to ask?” “Um, yeah. Where will I shower and use the facilities?” “We have an entire bathroom set up for you in our upstairs bathroom, but isn’t there something else?” She asked moving her face closer to you. “N-n-not that I can think of.” “Yes there is. I know it from talking to you. You can ask, I’m not going to be rude about it.” You stood there a little scared from her staring at you with those massive eyes and you had no clue what she thought you were going to ask.

Talking to her, you only had two real questions: Why she was nice to total stranger not even of the same race as her and… would she go out with you. That’s when it all clicked into place. She had sensed the care you had for her and kept it a secret this whole time. You felt weak knowing whatever you felt couldn’t be kept secret. “Oh please don’t feel that way. I just like to make sure someone is happy and sometimes those kinds of things get sensed.” “Well here goes, even though I don’t see a point in asking. Serene, would you go out with me?” “Of course” She said as she wrapped you in a hug.

You did your best to hug her back, but it was so hard with her size compared to yours. A knock interrupted your hug and she loosened up on you. “Serene, are you there?” “Yes mom and I have our guest.” “Please come out, we would all like to meet him.” “Okay mom, just a second.” She gave you a quick kiss and levitated you to the top of her head. She then walked over to the door and you saw the entire family waiting at the door. Your eyes got really big at seeing eight different faces and fear spread over you like a veil.

All of them, looking at you, and you would have to talk to all of them. “Well let’s all get to know each other where we aren’t crowding each other out” A male Eevee said. Everybody started walking downstairs and Serene followed behind them. “Hey, everything will be okay. They won’t tear you apart. Remember, we’re not evil, we’re just bigger than you.” Serene whispered up to you. Although you were still frightened, her words helped to soothe you.

Serene’s parents told everyone good night and made their way to bed. Ashley went to the living room and turned on the television. Sarah and Lily pleaded to watch their own show, and when faced with Ashley’s refusal, they headed to their own rooms. That left Serene, you, Andrew, Matt, and Greg standing in the kitchen.

Serene was about to lift you off the table and head upstairs when Andrew put a hand on her shoulder. “Sis, can we talk to Roy alone?” “What about” Serene asked, casting a suspicious glance at her brothers. “Just a little talk, man to men.” Greg said. ‘More like man to giants’ you thought to yourself as you fearfully awaited her decision. “I guess, just no hurting him or scaring him. He’s already scared as is.” Serene said as she looked at you with caring eyes. You gave her a face that almost showed abandonment. She walked over to you and moved her face in close to yours. “They aren’t going to hurt you and try not to let them intimidate you.” She said as she stood up straight and walked upstairs. ‘Yeah, don’t be intimidated Roy, they’re just a lot bigger than you, more powerful than you, and it’s three to one. What do you have to be afraid of?’ you said in your mind as the brothers all took seats close to you.

“So how are things Roy? Everything working out alright?” Greg said as he put on a smile. That smile made you nervous and you nodded your head, unable to utter any words. “Boy she wasn’t kidding when she said he was scared. Are you sure we should be doing this? Dad doubts his abilities and trusts him.” Andrew said. “While he may be small, there should be no doubt about his abilities. I don’t want my sister to be hurt by his kind because we underestimated him.” Matt said as he shot you a flash of those sharp teeth. You felt a little hurt by that stereotype and shocked by their knowledge of you and Serene’s companionship. “That looks tells me you’re a bit shocked. If it’s about you and Serene going out, we knew that long before you asked. She told us all about how you liked her.” Greg said. That was one question out of the way, but they still had their stereotype going against you.

“So why did you want to come here?” Matt asked. “B-because I needed to go to sc-school and thought I’d try for here.” “Sure, but what makes our school so special? Is it because you can stay with our sister?” “N-no” You replied, watching as Greg and Matt slowly moved their faces closer to you. Andrew just seemed to be there for support of their obviously-successful fear tactic, but what he said next soon took away that hope. “So why should we trust you? I mean your kind does harm and kill each other for no truly worthy purpose. So how do we know you won’t try that here?” You weren’t sure how to answer or if you even could answer. Sure, there were obviously bad people, but how could you tell them about the good people? Not many of those good people were put down in the history books, only those who lived off wealth or had done some massive crime.

They all waited for an answer, but not a single response came to you. “Just as I thought, here to do harm and no good.” Greg said as he quickly shut his trap. You noticed it looked like his mouth was glowing and that’s when you knew he was about to attack. Anywhere you could run was open space and the other two could always get you if Greg missed. You cowered and waited for something. You laughed in your mind how you thought coming to this world would be so cool. Full of huge, anthromorphic pokemon and you got to stay with one. ‘Oh, how quickly the tides turn’ you said in your mind as you braced for the hit.

“What do you think you’re doing?!” Ashley said as she stood at the doorway. You looked at her and so did the brothers. “We’re making sure he doesn’t hurt Serene” Greg said as the attack he had charged seemed to be lost. “By attacking him? Even if it was louder than yours, you had her dominated in how quick it was beating. “What are you doing?! He’s a human and you know what they’ve done!” “Yes I do, but I doubt all of them are like those examples you’ve heard of. Besides Serene is smart and would only choose someone she knew she could trust. You were there when she refused to go out with Jared.” Greg growled in defeat and Andrew seemed to be thinking. Matt sat there with electricity arcing over himself. Ashley turned around and you held tight to her. You weren’t sure how easy it would be to be held and walking, and you had been so frightened by Matt, Greg and Andrew that you were shivering. She started to walk out when Matt said “You’re making a big mistake. He’s only going to hurt somebody!” “Maybe, but there is only one way to find out. Besides, he's cute and doesn’t seem evil.”

You closed your eyes and held tight to her, feeling that if you loosened up even a little, the three brothers would be there to bring you harm. “It’s okay, we’re going to go see Serene and everything will be alright.” Ashley whispered down to you. You didn’t open your eyes or flinch, you just clung to her. Her hand soon surrounded you as you felt her move up the stairs and knock on the door. “Yes?” you heard Serene ask. “It’s your big sis, open up.” She did and saw her sister standing there. “What is it?” Ashley opened her hand that held you and Serene saw you. You were still clung tight to Ashley’s breast, but you were trembling with fear and had an irregular breathing pattern. “I think I should come in so we can talk” Ashley said and Serene stood aside. As soon as both sisters were in the room, they both sat on the bed and Serene closed the door with her psychic powers. “What happened to him?” Serene asked. “Our brothers wanted to make sure that he didn’t hurt any of us, especially you.” Ashley said as she stroked your back. You didn’t respond. All you did was turn your head more into Ashley’s chest. “I think right now he’s paralyzed with fear and unsure of whom he can trust. You all sat there and after a lot of having your back stroked, you started to loosen up on Ashley. “Do you feel a little better?” She asked as she looked down on you. Sis here said you were quiet for one reason, and tonight seemed like it was just you being rude.” You dropped your head and sighed. “What, did I say something wrong?” Ashley asked as she cocked her head. “No, it’s just that people always thought the same exact thing back in his world and he was hoping here would be different.” “Oh… I would like to know how you know so much about him.” “Because everything I know he told to me or explained when I asked.” Ashley nodded and Serene wrapped you in a hug and began stroking you.” “Thanks sis.” Serene said. “No problem. Somebody had to be on his side along with you. Besides, Matt, Greg, and Andrew weren’t thinking the way they should have. Do YOU trust me?” She asked looking at you. You broke away from Serene to smile and say yes. Ashley was a bit surprised that you talked, but nonetheless accepted it. “Good night” you all said to each other and Ashley left Serene’s room.

“I’m sorry they did that to you.” Serene said as she kissed you. “It’s okay and it’s like Ashley said, they did it because they care about you.” She looked like she was going to say something, but kept her mouth shut. “One thing I have to ask, where is the restroom in case I need to use it?” She set you on the floor and sent you off towards a hole in the wall. “Through there is a bathroom made for your size and no one can disturb you there. It’s got everything you’ll need.” You nodded and walked through the hole. You looked for a light switch and when you found it, you flipped it up. The bathroom had been bathed in light and you saw it was more than big enough. It had a nice shower and a bunch of other good things. “How did you do this?” You yelled out for her to hear. “Very carefully. I had to use my powers to build everything in there. You turned on everything and saw that it worked. “Where is this even at? You said it was in your bathroom.” “It is. It’s just behind the cabinet to where nobody can get to it. Is it good?” You walked out and gestured for her to get closer. You kissed her and said it’s excellent.

You climbed up her desk to go to bed and you were stopped halfway up. “Where are you going?” “To bed” She laid on her bed and levitated you over to her. “You sleep with me, Roy.” “You blushed and replied “Really? What do your parents think?” She cuddled you up in her arms and started to drift off to sleep. “Who do you think gave me permission?” You were in the valley of her chest and you both drifted off to sleep.
1152111.title: An After Dinner Conversation

choices: You have to make a speech in front of the whole school
Rather than a speech, your info is in the school paper
11521112.content:
You woke up and stared into the darkness that surrounded you. You were unsure of why you woke up and you didn’t feel like you would be asleep anytime soon. Slowly, you maneuvered out of Serene’s chest and walked down to the foot of her bed. Searching for a way to get down, you noticed her sheets touched the floor. You scurried down them and soon both feet made contact with the floor. You wandered off into your bathroom to use the facilities as well as take a soothing shower, hoping it would help relax both mind and body.

That’s when you realized the reason you had awoken was because of your fear; the fear if this world would be as harsh as Serene’s brothers had been. Would this entire world think of humans as a living evil? Sure Serene and Ashley trusted you, but what if nobody else did? They may attack like Matt, Greg, and Andrew wanted to and Serene may try to take the hits for you. You didn’t want her hurt because of what you were, even if neither of you had control over it. You finished your shower, got dressed, and wandered back out.

Nothing had changed during your shower: Serene was still asleep, darkness still enveloped everything, and the moon still gleamed through the window. You wanted to look outside and see what it looked like, but there was no way you were just going to get to the windowsill. That’s when you noticed her desk was close enough that you could climb the desk and just walk to the window. You indeed found a way to the flat of the desk and moved over to the window. The moon looked dazzling and the world looked so different. That’s when your thoughts came back to you.

‘What if this world really is that bad? What if nobody trusts me? I don’t want an entire school hating the only human there. Is there some way I can change their thinking?’ You shook the thoughts off and ended your thinking process with hopes: Hopes this world will trust you, hopes you can make friends, hopes that things will be better than you thought before. Soon you heard some noises and looked over to the bed.

“Roy.” Serene said in a sleep state as she touched the region on her chest where you were sleeping. When she felt nothing but herself, she sat up, snapped awake and looked around. “Roy?!” She called out a little louder than before. “I’m over here, by the window” You said as you waved a bit. She noticed your silhouette and levitated it back to her bed. Although you liked being by the window, at least now you didn’t have to climb back down and then up again.

“What’s the matter? I can tell you’re afraid, but why? My brothers didn’t scare you again somehow, did they?” “No it’s just I’m worried, worried if everyone else will think of me as your brothers did.” “Oh Roy” Serene said as she hugged you as tight as she could without hurting you. She just sat there and hugged you until she spoke up again. “Roy, I don’t think many of us here think of you guys as evil. There may truths to what is said, but most know that only a slim few are evil. I know a bunch of my friends think you were pretty cute and not evil.” “Yeah and Ashley does too, but what about Greg’s friends? You and your friends see me as nice, but what about him and all his comrades? That’s what scares me.” “Well, you said it yourself that they were mean for my protection, so everyone else should be less caring about you than they were. Let’s go to sleep, it’s late and we’re both tired.” You indeed were tired and you snuggled up in her warm fur. Soon you had both drifted off to sleep for the night.

The next morning soon came and the sun was evidence of that. You flinched at the sight of the sunlight, but Serene only seemed to want to bathe in it. “Morning there, cutie” She said as she giggled. “Good morning” You said as she stood up and stretched. She laid you back down and started to stroke you. It felt so good, but it seemed to paralyze you. “Relaxing, isn’t it?” You only nodded and smiled up at her. “Good. Well let’s get the day started. I’ve got to go take a shower so I’m not waiting all morning. I’ll see you when I get back.” She said as she set you near your bathroom and winked at you. You blushed and quickly went into your bathroom. You got in the shower and enjoyed this time around more than you did last night. This time, your mind was clear and you were completely awake. You finished up and got ready for your first day at school with Serene.

You were in your “house” and about to walk out when you saw an Umbreon, a Flareon, and a Jolteon. You quickly run back in and hide in some crevice, hoping that if they were here for you, this spot would keep you hidden. “Hey Serene, we want to talk.” Andrew said. “I bet she’s already in the bathroom. Great, now we’ll have to wait!” Matt said as he bolted out of the room. “No patience whatsoever. I guess he’s right and we’ll have to wait to talk about our little guest with her until later.” Greg said as both he and Andrew walked out of her room. You slowly breathed out in relief as Greg’s tail snaked around the doorframe. You waited a few more seconds just to be sure they were gone before you came out of hiding. How would breakfast go when you were at the same table as them? Your thoughts were interrupted as a door shut and you were bathed in a pink glow. Serene laid down on her bed and brought you over to her. “Well, I’m back. Did you miss me?” Unsure of why she would ask that, you just played along and said yes. “Aw, well I missed you too.” She kissed you and sat in her room for a little while.

“So how many bathrooms are in this house?” “Three, one for my parents, one for us girls, and one for the guys. But I guess there is one more” She said as she looked at the hole in her wall. You both sat there for a few more minutes before she spoke up. “Hey, why are you nervous again? Did my brothers come in here while I was gone?” “Yes they did, but that’s not why I’m concerned. I know you can see the future, so why didn’t you see your brothers going after me?” “Well, I don’t like to see the future because there’s no fun in it. It’s kind of like reading a plot summary of a book before you actually read the book. So I try and avoid looking in the future unless absolutely necessary. But I guess that did cause some problems.” You nodded in understanding and cuddled up in between her breasts. “So what did my brothers want?” “To talk to you about the little guest.” She grumbled and started petting you. “I won’t let them lay a paw on you.” You just let her run her fingers over your body.

“Hey kids, it’s time to eat!” Her father yelled up the stairs. Serene sat up and moved you to her head. She was about to get off her bed when you stopped her. “Serene, can I ask a question?” “Sure, what is it?” “Can I touch the orb on your forehead please?” “Of course, but why?” “It’s just kind of cute and I always wanted to touch it.” “So… you don’t think I look weird with it?” “Of course not. Why would you think that?” “Well you lived in the human world and nobody there had things like fur or tails or anything we have. So I thought that you might think we look like freaks.” “Oh Serene, that’s what makes you guys so cool. We don’t have unique things like tails and that’s what makes Pokemon like you so cute and cool. Besides, you flicked your tail enough during our conversations to know I liked it.” She turned her head a bit as she looked like she was blushing. She lowered you off her head to give you a kiss and then moved you to her red orb. You slowly touched it and sort of rubbed it. You liked touching it and she set you back on her head.

She walked out of her room and stood at the door for a second before walking down the stairs. “So what makes us so cute?” “I-I-I don’t know. There isn’t any specific thing. It’s everything. No part of you really is better than another.” She giggled as she walked in the kitchen. You looked at the table and saw that everybody was looking at you and Serene, especially Greg, Ashley, Matt, and Andrew. You knew she would have to take a seat by Andrew, but she had Ashley on the other side. You whispered in her ear, “If you would please, can I stay on your shoulder and you pass food to me so I’m not in your brothers’ sights as easily?” She didn’t respond. All she did was sit down and lower you to her shoulder that Ashley was near.

“So how did you two sleep?” Kathy asked. You were still trying to get it in your head to call her Kathy and her husband Marcus rather than Mr. and Mrs. Variform. “We slept great mom. No problems at all.” “That’s good to hear. Well everybody dig in.” Soon everybody had plates filled with breakfast and slowly the food disappeared. Serene indeed passed you food and you stayed out of Andrew’s sight. Though you sort of wished you would have picked the other shoulder as occasionally you would look up and either Matt or Greg would be looking at you. Then either you would quickly look back down at your plate and ignore those eyes, or Ashley would move her head so they couldn’t see you. When everyone was finished, they set their dishes in the sink, said goodbye to their parents and went off to school. The walk there a little unnerving as one of the brothers would try and keep up with Serene. You climbed up to her head and just laid your face flat down, acting like no one was there. Soon enough you looked up and saw what you assumed was the school. She stopped outside of the school and took you up in her hands.
11521112.title: Late Night Thoughts

115211122.content:
Lily and Sarah kept walking, presumably to a grade school. They had to be eight graders, or really big for whatever age they were. Greg, Matt, Andrew, and Ashley all went in while Serene just looked at you with her gorgeous eyes. “Uh… W-What do you want?” She seemed to snap out of a trance before she spoke. “Sorry, you just look so cute. I was going to tell you about how the day is going to play out. Well you were going to have to make a speech, but I knew you wouldn’t be able to do it, so I convinced our principal to let you skip it.” You immediately looked up to her and smiled. The only words that came out of your mouth were “thank you”. She gave a giggle and put you back on her head, and then she spoke again.

“You’re very welcome. Instead there’s an article in our school paper about you. Anybody with questions is supposed to come and ask me.” “So what am I going to do most of the day?” You asked as you were unsure of how your classes were going to play out with your miniature size. “Well, I think you’re supposed to pay attention to the lecture, but you’re either on me or my desk. So no dozing off during class.” You sighed after she said that, but you knew there was no way to get a nap in even if you wanted to. Either she would wake you or someone else would.

“If you don’t mind, I kind of would like to hide in your luscious locks until first hour. That way I’m not the immediate center of attention.” “Thanks for the compliment, but why would you want to hide in my hair? Don’t you like my chest?” “Well yes, but… it’s just kind of… you know, strange.” “Yeah, but it’s something nobody else can experience. But I guess that does make a little strange. I’ll let you in my hair for now, but just know I don’t have a problem with you being so close to my heart.” She levitated you up to her head and you soon moved her silky hair around so you could hide in it. As soon as there was enough to hide you and little enough to see through, you went prone and just waited.

She walked in and your ears filled with voices, both male and female. There was another question answered: this school was for both genders. Everybody looked at her and a few asked her about you. She didn’t reveal your location, but she explained a little about your personality. They understood and looked depressed when they didn’t get to see you. You felt like a jerk, but your fear kept you pinned in your position.

She walked into a room that would appear to be the office. An anthromorphic Gardevoir sat behind the desk and stopped writing to look up at Serene. “Ah Serene, how nice to see you. Where is our new student?” “He’s here, but he’s a tad bit shy and decided he wanted to hide.” “Aw, but we won’t hurt him.” You couldn’t but laugh at her comment. Serene’s brothers had cast doubt on that theory. “I heard him, but why was he laughing?” “Well, Mrs. Sytes, we had a little incident that kind of scarred him and he has a hard time believing no one will harm him. Roy, you should know better. We talked about this.” “What happened? Did he get hurt?” Mrs. Sytes asked with concern. “I’d rather not say, but the only injuries he took were mental.” Serene stopped as seemed to pause.

Soon you felt yourself being pulled from her hair and soon you were out in the open. The only person there was Mrs. Sytes and she stood up and walked over to see you. You were slowly lowered into Serene’s hands and looked up at her face with a crossed expression. “Sorry, but not everyone is going to hurt you. You’ve got to believe me.” Serene said as Mrs. Sytes looked at you carefully. “I certainly won’t hurt you. You’re as adorable as Serene said.” She went to reach for you and you cringed a bit. She pulled her hand back, then slowly extended it until it was touching you. “There. Is that so bad?” She then picked you up and examined you carefully. She set you back in Serene’s hands and smiled. “See Roy, no harm done. As you’ve heard, I’m Mrs. Sytes and I’m the secretary.” You waved and Serene started to speak. “Like I said, he’s timid and not got much to say.” “That’s okay. You should probably go see Mrs. Blaze. She’s been waiting to see you both all morning. We’ll see you two again some time.” “Okay bye Mrs. Sytes.” You said goodbye, but obviously in a voice too quiet for her to hear.

You fell back in Serene’s hand as you felt so pathetic and weak, like you were actually an infant with high school kids. Serene obviously caught on to it and gave you a dirty look. She shifted you over to one hand and with her other, opened the door to where you assumed Mrs. Blaze was. Indeed, as the door cracked open, a figure looked up from her desk. You got a good look of Mrs. Blaze: she was a tall anthro Typhlosion that had a great figure, but she didn’t look as good as Serene. Her flame collar-thing was a nice touch. Hopefully Serene wouldn’t get offended with you looking at other females. You didn’t look in a bad way. You were just curious how anthro Pokemon look. “Ah, Miss Variform, how good it is to see you. And there’s the little guy in your hands.” You tried not to show any reaction physically, but you really didn’t like everyone pointing out your size. “Good morning Mrs. Blaze and yes, here he is. Meet Roy.” She lifted you up closer to Mrs. Blaze. “Nice to meet you Roy.” “You nodded and gave a little wave. “Are you sure you don’t want to talk about your world to the entire student body? It sure would help us understand more about you.” You just lowered your head and gave an uncomfortable shake. “We’re sorry Mrs. Blaze, but he’s timid and has a hard enough time talking to one new person. I don’t think he could handle our entire school.” “That’s quite alright Serene. I can’t imagine it’s easy talking to someone so much larger than you, even without being shy. Could excuse me a moment?”

Mrs. Blaze stopped and held her head a little higher. She opened her mouth shot a little flame stream out. Then the image of Greg wanting to incinerate you flashed in your mind and you cowered in fear. Mrs. Blaze immediately stopped and looked down at you. “Is everything alright?” “Yes I think he’s alright, just a little afraid of your fire.” “I’m sorry. I do that just to clear my throat.” You were still afraid and cowering. She reached down to stroke you when she stopped. “Is it alright if I stroke him a bit?” Mrs. Blaze asked. “I think so, just be slow and gentle.” Serene said as she breathed slowly. Mrs. Blaze leaned in for a closer look at you as well as to calm you down. She moved her head away when she had taken a good look and moved her hand in closer. You tried not to move away, but it seemed like such a challenge. Finally her gentle fingers slowly glided down your back. They seemed so calm and caring, as if she knew exactly how to pet you. You slowly loosened up and felt soothed by her finger movements. “There you go. I’m sorry if you were at all frightened. Oh look at the time. Serene, you and Roy should be on your way to class.”“Yes Mrs. Blaze. We’ll see you later.” You waved and Mrs. Blaze gave a little wave back.

She walked out of the office and towards her first hour class. “So Greg scared you with his fire?” You nodded as she set you back on top of her head. The hallways were empty, probably as all the students were in class. “I wish he would just trust you. I don’t intend to be mean, but you’re too small to do any real damage.” You had to agree with her, but you wished she could’ve worded it a little better. She walked until she stopped at a door. You looked around until you saw a sign on the door.
115211122.title: Going to School with the Huge

1152111222.content:
You watched as the door that read “Battle Strategies” and “Mr. Shartney” was slowly pushed open. Inside was a class of about twenty students and an anthro Raichu as the teacher. “Ah good morning Serene. Please take your seat.” The Raichu said and Serene obeyed. She walked towards the back of the room and took a seat left of the middle row. You sighed knowing that she wouldn’t be in the middle of everyone, leaving you as the center of attention. Serene had an empty desk in front of her, a Sceptile to her left, and an Aggron to her right. “Class, I have been informed that after this lecture, you will have time to meet your new classmate. Anything else you would like to know about him will be in the school paper.” You cowered as every face but three looked at you: Those three being Serene’s face, the Aggron, and Mr. Shartney. Everyone slowly turned back around and you just as slowly relaxed.

The class went on and you attempted to pay attention, but you really weren’t sure how you would be able to use of any of these strategies, as most of them involved some ability you lacked. You would occasionally look over at the Aggron, wondering why he didn’t stare at you as everyone else had. He would look at you for a little, then quickly flash back to the lesson.

After a lot of talk about how to attack efficiently, Mr. Shartney sat behind his desk. “Well class, that concludes today’s lesson. I’m sure you’re all curious about Roy, but I think you need to be calm and patient. Remember he’s smaller than you and not capable of defending himself as you might be. Let’s get some kind of line to meet him so there’s not a swarm around him. Alana, you’ll start and we’ll snake through the class.” Alana, a female Absol, stood up and walked back. You grunted, knowing that meeting Serene’s family was a challenge, but this would be worse. Serene lifted you off her head and set you on the desk. Alana walked back and bent over to get a better look at you. “Hi Roy. I’m Alana.” You nodded and gave a little wave. She looked at Serene with a dirty grin and walked away.

After that, everybody greeted you and added something with it. The girls would mention something about your appearance and the guys would attempt a handshake. Finally it came down to the Sceptile, Serene, and the Aggron. The Sceptile reached over and stuck out his hand. “Name’s Clay. Nice to meet ya.” You shook his finger as a handshake and you couldn’t help but feel like he had a cowboy vibe to him. Serene was next, but all she did was wink. You smiled at her and turned to the Aggron. He spun around in his chair and looked at you. “I’m Mathias. It’s a pleasure to meet you.” You shook his hand, but something about him seemed… familiar. He turned back swiftly and looked at the teacher. “Okay class, now that we all have met him, wait for the bell.” Mr. Shartney would occasionally yell at someone to sit down, as they were trying to sneak back and talk to you or Serene. You climbed onto her open hand and laid down on it. Talking to so many people had exhausted you for some reason. Maybe the pressure of talking to people had gotten to you. “The bell’s about to ring. Remember to check the paper for stuff about Roy.” The bell rang and as Serene was about to walk past, Mr. Shartney stopped her.

“Serene, could you please give me a second to meet Roy myself?” She nodded and past you from her hand into Mr. Shartney’s. “Nice to meet you Roy. I’m Mr. Shartney and I’m the Battle Strategy teacher. I know this class seems a bit hard for you to learn anything from, but try and pay attention. If you need anything, you should let one of the staff members know.” You nodded and waited for what else he had to say. “Serene has told us about your social issues. It’s not going to be easy avoiding conversations, but try your best and not let your problem constrict you. Thank you Serene for your time and good luck with your classes.” “Thank you Mr. Shartney.” Serene said as she accepted you back into her hands.

“How was the first class, cutie?” “Um okay, but hard to stay focused. Can I ask a few questions?” You asked. “Well of course.” Serene said as you assumed she flashed a smile. “Why did that Absol Alana give you that weird smile?” “She’s my best friend and when I told her that you were going to be staying with me, she got a little jealous.” “Oh. Why did Mathias seem familiar?” You asked and Serene gave a little laugh. “Well I wondered what you would think of him when you met him. It’s kind of ironic because he’s just like you; Quiet and nice. The only real difference is that you’re with me and he’s not.” She gave you a little kiss and you turned away with embarrassment. “O-Okay last few. What’s the next class?” “Another one where you will be bored: Combat class.” Your jaw dropped and you were hoping that you wouldn’t have to battle.

“Last one and I hope you don’t get mad if I ask. You’re the most beautiful girl I’ve seen here and I know I shouldn’t, but are you mad that I look at other girls? I don’t mean to in a bad way, just out of curiosity.” She stopped walking and looked at you with a serious tone. “I don’t like you looking, but I know that you aren’t checking them out. You’re just looking at how we all appear with our different features. Besides, it’s not looking that will get me mad at you, but the emotions you feel. Just hope my brothers don’t notice.” She was about to kiss you, but you quickly kissed her lip before she got you. “Thanks gorgeous” You said with a smile. She finished her kiss and grinned. She then walked down the hall towards the next class.

She walked through some double doors into what seemed to be a stadium. Over near the far wall stood all the students, with what appeared to be a Lucario and a Ditto. “Well the Lucario is the teacher, Mrs. Taoshen, and the Ditto is the assistant, Mr. Kainen.” You nodded as she ran over to where everyone was, leaving you hanging on to her hair. She stopped and whispered “Sorry”. You took some deep breathes and waited for the introduction. “Okay class, nice to see you all. Roy, although you are a student, I don’t think you’re capable of fighting here and will be sitting out.” You sighed in relief, knowing that you could sit back and watch the fights. “Okay, without further ado, let’s get started.”

Everybody cheered, but they were interrupted by Mr. Kainen. “I think I know a way for Roy to fight without his opponent having too many major advantages.” Everybody gave an eager look except you. Mr. Kainen started to change forms and when he finished, he looked all too familiar. Everybody got closer when they saw he had transformed into a larger version of you. Every girl, even Mrs. Taoshen, mentioned how good you really looked. “Although it makes a great show, it still would be a bit too unfair of a fight.” Mr. Kainen laughed and returned to his normal self. You were still trying to get your jaw off the ground. “Hey, I still think you look a lot better, even if had a perfect transformation.” You appreciated the compliment, but you only hoped that Serene kept a watchful eye on you. Those girls sure eyed your mirror image and there was no telling what they would do if they could get you alone.

You watched everybody fight, from Clay fighting a female Bayleef ironically named Bailey to the Plusle and Minun twins Jake and Blake dueling each other. The final fight was announced to be Serene Versus Mrs. Taoshen. Before she left you looked up to her and said “Try not to get hurt. I don’t want to see you get hurt and I can’t do a thing about it” “Aww. Don’t worry, I won’t. I’ll leave you with Alana while I’m gone. She’s nice, so don’t be afraid of her.” You nodded and watched Serene walk towards the field. Alana picked you up off the ground where Serene had left you and carry you over to a side of the stadium. She sat down and held you in one hand and gently stroked you with the other. “Hi Roy.” “H-Hi Alana.” “Don’t be scared. I won’t hurt you. I’m Serene’s best friend, plus you’re too cute to want to hurt.” You turned your head away, blushing and laughing to yourself. ‘Too cute? Too bad Serene’s brothers didn’t go with that’ you thought as Serene had started fighting. The battle was intense and no one seemed to have an upper hand. “So how are things between you two, because if they aren’t good, I wouldn’t mind going with someone like you.” Alana said as she smiled down at you. “Things are okay, I guess.” “Darn, but at least she found someone like you.”

“H-How many people has Serene gone out with or at least had asked her out?” “Well she’s never dated anyone, but had a lot of guys ask her out.” “Why didn’t she go out with them? She couldn’t have been waiting for me the whole time.” “When you started talking she did, but before that no. The reason is because the guys who asked her out usually were just in it for the sex. I unfortunately dated some of them. I just wish I could have someone like you.” You sat there in silence until a thought crossed your mind. “What about Mathias?” “What?” You cringed a little as she dropped her head towards you rather than the battle. “Sorry, didn’t mean to startle you. Now what about Mathias?” “W-Why don’t you go out with him? Serene said he’s just like me, except that he’s more similar to you than I am.” “You think he would go out with someone like me?” “I-I don’t see why not. You seem a lot like Serene and when she finally mentioned us going out, it felt great knowing she would go out with someone like me. Maybe he wants to go out with you, but is just afraid of hearing no. Ask him, but be nice. If he is like me, he will be happy to go out with someone like you.” “He is cute and does act like you. Maybe I should. For someone so timid and afraid, you sure do have some good advice.” Finally, Serene won. She helped Mrs. Taoshen up and walked back to Alana.
1152111222.title: First Two Classes of the Day

11521112221.content:
Alana handed you back to Serene with grateful, yet envious eyes. “Thanks Serene. It was nice to be able to hold him for at least a little while.” Alana said with a smile. “You’re welcome and who knows, maybe if they send another human through, it could end up with you.” Serene smiled at Alana, then returned her attention back to you. “I missed having you by me and look, not too many scratches like I told you.” You smiled up to her and she brought you up to her face. You gave a hug to the best of your abilities and she rubbed you gently with her face. Her fur felt so soft, a softness that almost sent you into a peaceful sleep. Soon though, she broke away, set you on her head and turned to look at Mrs. Taoshen and Mr. Kainen. “Excellent job today class. Although there are some things that need to be worked on, you all still are doing well. Continue all your hard work and reach your pinnacle. Until next time, farewell.” Mrs. Taoshen and Mr. Kainen both gave a slight bow, as did the entire class. When Serene gave her bow, you fell off but stopped in mid-air when she caught you with her psychic abilities. You landed back atop her head.

A bell sounded and everyone walked out of the class, but once again, Serene was stopped by the teachers. She walked over once again for a more personal introduction. “Hello Roy, as you’ve probably heard, I’m Mrs. Taoshen and this is Mr. Kainen.” You waved up to them and smiled. “As I’m sure Mr. Shartney told you, although it’s almost useless to you, you should still pay attention. We’ll try to find a way to get you involved so you’re doing something, even if it’s not directly what the rest of the students are doing.” You dropped your head somewhat and Mrs. Taoshen laughed, presumably at you wanting to do nothing. “Roy, I hope you weren’t offended in any way by my taking your form. I heard you were a little timid and thought you may relax a bit.” You shook your head in “no” gesture and looked back at him. “Good, well Mrs. Taoshen, I think they should be off to their next class, don’t you?” “How right you are. Serene, Roy, good luck with the rest of your classes and we will see you both later.” You waved as Serene walked away and out in the hallway.

“Have fun with Alana?” “Meh, I talked but I don’t think she likes me being afraid of her.” “You’re afraid of her? But she’s my best friend.” “Yeah and your brothers care about you greatly, yet they still wanted to hurt me.” You turned away, feeling the pain of her brothers once again assault you. The pain always seemed to come back at the worst times. Worse yet, something inside started to point to her as being part of your problem. She soon levitated you down from her head and forced you to look at her. She was about to speak, but instead put you between her breasts. She hugged you and you hugged her back.

The pain you felt about feeling she was a source of your pain was just as intense the pain you mentally felt inflicted by her brothers. You tried to repress the emotion and let the love you felt for her be the emotion she sensed rather than the pain, even though she had probably already sensed it. “Roy, I know it hurts and you partially feel a bit angry at me. But you don’t blame your all pain on me, do you?” “No. Something tells me to blame you for leaving me there, but I don’t want to. I know it’s not your fault. I just wish… I just wish they would’ve at least let me have a chance rather than eliminate before they knew anything.” You plunged your head deeper into her chest, feeling it helped a little.

“Let’s just get to class and just in case, I’m sorry.” Serene pulled you from her chest and cuddled you next to her face. “So am I.” You said as you hugged her face as tight as you could manage. She set you down in her chest and you looked up at her with confused and concerned eyes. “I know it seems a bit strange and uncomfortable, but I want you to be close to my heart and I’m sure it’s warm and comfortable. Plus you’re out of sight for the most part, except to the perverted guys.” You did like being between her breasts and it was a safe and comfortable place, but even touching a woman’s chest was a bit strange, yet Serene liked having you there. Was she personally enjoying having you there or did she really like having you close to her heart. She did seem like she wanted your entire being, not just your body.

Soon you snapped out of your trance and looked to see the third class of the day. She walked into a classroom full of students with a female Dragonair as the teacher. The teacher’s eyes seem to say “relax” and you did. “Good morning you two. Please take your seat Serene.” Whoever she was, she sure had a gentle nature. You noticed Alana and Mathias were in this class. You kept looking, seeing no more familiar faces except… except a familiar face that belonged to an Umbreon. “Serene, get me out of here before Andrew sees me!” You yelled up to her so she could hear, but nobody else. She whispered down to you so only you could hear. “Relax, he can’t hurt you and when we get home, I won’t let him or my other brothers get near you. Besides, he should know that I have more control of where on my body you are.” You settled in a bit more, but with a stressed mind. ‘Yeah, but every plan has its flaws.’ She took a seat in the first column on the right and the middle row. Unfortunately, all the kids you thought were trustworthy were on the other side of the room and Andrew was a seat back and to the left of Serene.

She plucked you from her breasts and set you on the desk. “So what class are we in and who is she?” “Well this is our math class and she is Ms. Passel. She’s really good at math. I just wish I was as good as she is.” You notice she lowers her head a bit and you walk as close to her as you can and gently stroke an area of it. “Well I’m good at math and I don’t think it’s wrong to help you. I think it could help me make it up to you for being so adorable and kind.” She instantly raises her eyes to look at you and she blushes a bit. “What do you mean ‘making it up to me’?” “Well you’ve done so much for me and I don’t think it’s fair if you do stuff for me and I give you nothing in return.” “But… you give me love and respect and that’s enough for me.” “But you give me the same things, yet you’re still giving more. If we’re giving the exact same things and you’re giving others that I can’t, I feel like I’ve got to make it up to you somehow, even if I am smaller.” She blushes even more and gives you kiss. “I don’t need anything except that loving personality and kind attitude of yours, cutie.”

You smile up to her and turn around, ready to see what this math class had to it. “Well let’s resume that trigonometry we’ve been working on. For those of you that haven’t yet met Roy, we will have some time after class.” Most of the kids gave some gesture as to joy, except those who had already seen you and someone a few seats behind Serene. You tried to see who or what it was, but from the desk, there was no way to see who it was. “Don’t worry about him. That’s Jared and since you can’t see, he’s a Shiftry. But you’ll have time to meet HIM later.” Serene seemed irritated for some reason and a growl came from behind her. ‘Is that the Jared that her brothers were talking about? The one that asked her out and she denied?’ You finished your thought and looked over at Andrew. For some odd reason, he was looking at you at the same time and nodded. You shuddered with fear. Could he tell what you were thinking, or was this another part of the fear tactic?

Ms. Passel started the lecture no too much later. You smiled when you realized when you had a useful class. You watched Ms. Passel write an equation on the board, then turn around and help Serene understand what was going on. You never felt like you were all that good of a teacher, but with the faces she made, you were better than you thought. You would notice Andrew looking over at you and you would do your best to not let his glare get to you, but it was a bit overpowering and you would stutter out of fear. Serene would take notice of your fear and look over to her brother, who would look away at just the right time, though Serene seemed to hold the suspicions in her mind.

After what seemed like a little bit, the lecture ended and the class swarmed you and gave a greeting, except for the ones who already met you and Jared. Ms. Passel watched all the students to be sure none of them brought you any kind of harm, but she looked shocked when the Shiftry remained in his seat. “Jared, don’t you wish to meet the new student?” Jared looked up with hatred showing in his face. “Me, talk to that little piece of trash? Not going to happen.” “Why? Are you jealous that he’s actually going out with me?” Serene said with that mellow voice of hers, yet something about her seemed different. Jared almost flew out of his seat when Serene said this. “WHAT?! No, but I do find it bull shit that he’s able to touch your boobs without any grit and you won’t even let me touch your hand!” “Well he cares about being close to my heart, unlike you, just wanting to get close to my…” “Alright class, let’s settle down.”

Again, like back in the human world, none of the students even cared what the teacher said. You were still on the desk when Serene stood up and looked directly at Jared. Everyone moved away from Serene. Although you couldn’t tell what others felt, you had to be a complete moron not to feel the hostility in the air. Jared seemed to ready an attack, and Andrew stood up and stepped in front of Serene. “Alright Jared, relax.” Jared didn’t seem as though he wanted to and he held his attack position. Now you were a possible target and had no shield of your own. You looked for a way out, but it was too far to fall and there was no safe place to jump to.

115211122212.content:
You watched as Jared’s hatred only seemed to rise. Serene looked at him with eyes that never shifted. Whether she knew Jared wouldn’t hurt you or she was just playing the odds again, you were abandoned on the desk. Whatever the case, you trusted her to know what she was doing. She may have a nearly costly error once, but she had said herself she would not allow the same incident twice. You shifted your eyes to Andrew, whom seemed only to stand in front of Serene without a concern of his own safety. Andrew seemed to care the most for Serene, as it seemed that he was the “nicest” one of Serene’s brothers at the table last night. “Andrew, what are you doing?” Questioned Serene. “Protecting you.” Responded Andrew. “He won’t do anything to me, not if he even wants a chance to be with me.” “That may be true, but nothing is guaranteed and I really ain’t feeling too lucky.” ‘Yeah, neither am I’ you thought as you dropped into a stance, prepared for anything.

“Now come on Jared, let’s just relax a bit.” Andrew spoke in a tone that would normally invoke peace, but Jared seemed far too infuriated to even listen. “SCREW YOU, YOUR SISTER, AND THAT LITTLE PIECE OF SCUM SHE’S WITH!” You started to lose your confidence with every second that passed. The tension only seemed to increase and Jared seemed only more volatile. Yet, even with the loss of confidence and Jared’s escalating hatred, your hope in Serene remained solid. You watched as Jared seemed to rapidly cock his arm back for a punch. Just before he launched it, Mathias stepped between the desk where you stood and Jared. “What do you think your doing?!” “Trying to solve this problem without much trouble.” Mathias said, obviously trying to keep the peace. “Freaking pacifist…” Jared let his fist go, presumably attempting to smash Mathias’s face in. Yet, although you couldn’t completely see what had happened, you could tell Mathias had caught Jared’s punch and you noticed Mathias pull his free hand back. He let it go and you could hear the impact of Mathias’s fist with Jared’s face. Seconds later, Jared hit the ground with a loud thud.

Everyone in the room gasped, except Mathias and the now unconscious Jared. “Ma-Mathias, go to the office.” Said Ms. Passel with fear across her face. Mathias sighed, but obeyed. Just before he passed you completely, he looked down at you and you thanked him, feeling as though he had somehow had done it for you and Serene. He found some way to grin and nod. After he had left the room, an anthro Chansey rushed in, picked Jared up off the floor and hauled him away. Before you knew it, you were being levitated to Serene’s head, whom had now returned to her seat. “You alright there cutie?” She asked in her tranquil voice. “Y-Yeah.” You also noticed Andrew had returned to his seat as well.

The class shifted to an awkward peace and just before the bell had rung, you were called up to Ms. Passel’s desk and Mathias had walked through the doors. He returned to his seat, not exactly smiling, but nowhere near pained. Ms. Passel made your acquaintance and you hers. You occasionally would look back to see Andrew attempting to talk to Mathias and when he had finished and made it back to his desk, Alana had casually walked over to his desk. She started talking to him and when she had stopped, Mathias gave her a stunned look. Apparently Alana decided to ask Mathias as soon as she could. After a long pause, he said something and Alana’s face lit up and she wrapped her arms around him. You grinned to yourself.

The bell rang not too long afterwards and Serene walked out with Alana almost rushing to catch up. Some people blocked her path and she soon vanished from sight. “So where are we going next?” “We have lunch, then homeroom, science, and cooking.” “Wait cooking, as in like with a stove and stuff?” “Yeah. Why, is that a problem?” “Well, I can’t cook with such big utensils and I’ll be small enough to eat.” “Nobody’s going to eat you. Not even my brothers would be that cruel to you.” “So can you please explain to me what the deal with Jared is?” She didn’t respond right away, but you could feel something out of place. “Later.” She responded briskly. You remained silent and still as she grabbed a tray of food. She took a seat at a table with Alana, Mathias, a female Ninetales, a female Lanturn, a Latias, and a female Milotic.

“Hey guys. I’m here with Roy.” Serene sat in between the Lanturn and Alana. “So Mathias, what made you decide to sit with us today?” He looked as though he were about to say something, but was cut off by the joyous Alana. “Well he decided to sit here because of me and that’s because I had a little help from Roy!” You felt Serene’s face shift to what could be assumed surprise. “What did you do?” You were about to tell her, but Alana cut you off. “Well while you were fighting Mrs. Taoshen, I mentioned how I wanted to be with someone like Roy and he said maybe I should ask Mathias. So I did and now we’re going out!” All the girls looked excited and you lowered yourself closer to Serene’s head. “Did you really?” “Yes. Where does Mathias usually sit?” You whispered into her ear. “Over there.” You looked to where she pointed and all you saw was an empty table. You couldn’t help but grin after realizing how similar you and Mathias really were. “What are you smiling about?” Serene asked, obviously sensing your joy. You didn’t respond, but you did slowly raise yourself from her head. “You did the exact same thing in your world, didn’t you?” You responded with a “yes” and climbed down to her shoulder. You looked over to see Mathias lower his head and chuckle. The girls looked at the two of you and shook their heads.

You had climbed down Serene’s arm and stood on the table when you were suddenly pulled upward with a pink aura all around you. “I think you should meet everyone before we get too far into lunch.” You had to agree, although eating seemed better than attempting to socialize. You had already met Alana and Mathias, so she sent you the opposite direction. You first stop was to the Lanturn. “Hi, I’m Cecilia.” You said hello back. You were shifted over to the Ninetales next, who seemed intrigued by you. “Hello there. My name is Vienna.” You gave a greeting and once again were moved, this time to the Milotic. “It’s nice to meet you. My name is Anastasia, but everyone calls me Stacey.” You nodded, said hi, and then you were levitated over to the only person you hadn’t met yet, the Latias. “Hi. I’m Rose.” You said hello and while you were floating back toward Serene, you asked a question loud enough so she could hear. “D-Do you have a brother?” “Yeah, his name is Antonio, and he’s over there.” She replied. You looked to where she pointed and you saw a large figure standing there that resembled a Latios. Your jaw dropped when you saw the large muscles on his body.

Serene carefully set you down on her shoulder and everyone immediately started eating the food in front of them. Occasionally, someone would stop and ask you a question about yourself, to which you would tell Serene your response and she would tell the inquiring person. After everyone had finished their lunch, all the girls shot you a cutesy look, to which you gave a shocked and confused look back. All the girls then giggled and, along with Mathias, walked away, except Serene and Alana. Most the girls looked good, but just in case Serene was testing you by saying she didn’t care, you avoided thinking anything like that. You climbed down from Serene’s shoulder to stand on the table and stretch. Alana tugged at Serene and after Alana giving a ‘let’s walk over there’ gesture, the two of them walked away. Although they moved far away enough you couldn’t hear a thing they said, they were only a few of their-size steps away. Even though you could still see them, they seemed so far away and you felt so alone.

Eventually they came back and sat down. You expected Serene to say something, but rather than hearing Serene’s voice, you felt Alana’s hands envelop you. All you saw was her large face glaring down at you, which caused you to feel a little intimidated. She said “thank you” and gave you a kiss. She carefully set you back down on the table and ran to catch up with Mathias. You watched her run away and you wanted to say something, but you couldn’t complete a single word. Serene only laughed, picked you up to her face and gave you a kiss. Now you had received two kisses from two different girls in less than two minutes, and that left you frozen in a state of confusion. Serene laughed when she pulled you away and you looked at her with even more confusion. She held a mirror so you could see yourself, and all you saw was how red your face had gotten.

Serene put you back atop her head and started to walk down the hall. “Are you okay up there Mr. Popular?” You were still paralyzed with confusion and you couldn’t even respond. She only giggled and kept walking. “I still love you more than anyone else can.” “A-A-As do I, gorgeous.” “So how did you know Rose had a brother?" “I knew because of a movie from back in my world.” “Really? How did it go?” You wanted to tell her, but you really didn’t feel like explaining the whole thing and ending on the loss of Latios. “Uh… I’d really rather not say.” She seemed determined to get an answer, but she respected your answer and backed off.

“So can I ask you some stuff when we get home?” “Sure, but why not here?” Questioned Serene. “Because I’d rather be with just the one I deeply love and trust.” She stopped to give you a kiss and had a wide smile on her face when she set you back on her head. “I love you more.” “Only because you’re bigger and have more room for love.” You said with a grin. She giggled and headed toward her next class or whatever homeroom could be considered.

1152111222121.content:
Serene kept walking through the crowded hallways and eventually stops at a classroom that seemed relatively small compared to the others. When she walked in, you noticed how there were only a few seats in the room.

“Why does this room seem smaller than the others?” You whispered into Serene’s ears as she filled an empty seat. “This classroom is used for advanced science, and not many people take it. Right now we have homeroom and later we’ll be back for science. A little tip: The teacher in here is Mr. Necroen and he’s against humans, but not to the point of pure hatred.” You nodded while putting that little fact in the back of your head. Serene sets you down on the desk, walks over to a table to grab a newspaper and heads back to her seat. She levitates you in the air, long enough so she can lay the newspaper on the desk. When she has the paper and you on the desk, she leans in to read some of the front page articles. Serene seemed more focused on an article towards the bottom of the page, so you walked further up the page to read little tidbits, like the name of the paper and such. ‘Inside the Ball’ reads the title and your palm instantly covers your face.

The rest of the students walk in just as the bell rings. A large Honchkrow, presumably Mr. Necroen, walks in and quickly looks over the class then he too gets lost in the paper. You look back down to the paper and notice the names of the authors: Antonio and Rose. It took a minute for things to click that the Latias and Latios you saw were the authors. You heard a giggle behind you and look up at Serene. You chuckle, shake your head, and then look around the rest of the room. You see a bunch of new faces, except for Clay. You look at the article Serene is reading and notice your picture. Your eyes get bigger with surprise and you walk over to read the article.

That’s when you noticed that the article is titled ‘Debate: Welcome Roy’. You look up to Serene with questioning eyes. She at first seems lost in the ink, but then her eyes look down to you. “You’re wondering about this article, aren’t you? Well in every paper, there is a section that involves a debate of some sort and since today is your first day here, they figured how we see you would make an excellent article.” You look at a chart that shows your overall percentage of likes to hates to uncertainty. Most votes were in the liked column, the second most in the unsure column, and very few were in the hated column. Then you look over at the article itself and notice lots of sections, one of them being other’s comments. You were curious to see what Antonio and Rose wrote about you and what the article said about your personal life.

Just as you had started reading however, you felt Serene gently nudge you. You look up to see Mrs. Sytes standing in the doorway. Serene was halfway standing when Mrs. Sytes gestures for her to sit back down. Serene gives a puzzled look and Mrs. Sytes lowers herself to a suitable talking level with Serene. “How are you two doing so far?” You look at Serene and she looks back down to you before responding “We’re okay.” Mrs. Sytes smiles a little more, but then looks Serene dead in the eyes.

“Mrs. Flame wants to have a word with you both, but… right now she needs to speak just with Roy.” You feel deeply fear stricken, but Serene’s face is one more of concern and curiosity. “But why just Roy? Why not me too?” Mrs. Sytes looked away briefly, then looked back to you and Serene. “Let’s talk in the hallway for a bit, so we don’t disrupt the class.” Serene picks you up and follows Mrs. Sytes out into the hallway. Thoughts about what was happening swirled in your mind and left you feeling paralyzed in confusion. Going to the office without Serene was going to be terrible, no matter why you were there. Mrs. Sytes and Serene both stopped in the middle of the hallway and both you and Serene stared uneasily at Mrs. Sytes, awaiting an answer to your burning question. Mrs. Sytes stayed silent as she seemed to ponder amongst the field of her mind.

Finally, she takes a deep breath and turned to face the both of you. “Please hear what I must say before you jump to any conclusions. We understand that you and Roy are a little bit better than just friends, but you two can not be together in homeroom.” Serene looked almost crushed, as if her most precious childhood possession had just been taken with no chance of getting it back. You too stood there stunned, eyes shifting from Mrs. Sytes to Serene, then back to Mrs. Sytes and finally the hands on which you stood. You didn’t know why, but it hurt so much knowing you two would be apart from each other. Serene was about to say something, but Mrs. Sytes spoke first. “On the request of a teacher, you two should not spend homeroom together and unfortunately, we have no choice but to go along with it.” This is when the power behind her words struck the hardest.

You felt a moment of weakness and fell to your knees, with your hands stopping you from falling flat on your face. The pain just stung, but no matter what you wanted to say or do, four words stopped you from doing anything: All because of you. You weren’t guaranteed but you guessed because you’re human, you two would end the day apart from each other. Soon teardrops that felt as heavy as your heart splashed off your backside. Again the words circulated through your mind, knowing because of your being, Serene was now letting tears fall like a spring rain. The pain had taken you both down so quickly and Mrs. Sytes seemed to want to give you your space and only when you both had calmed down a bit did she speak. “Although you two may not spend homeroom, you must be back together by the time of the following class. So for right now, I’ll take Roy with me to the office so he may speak with Mrs. Flame. Return to class and in the future think of someone you trust who will be in your next hour class and allow them to watch over Roy from the beginning of homeroom to the beginning of the next class. Then he avoids causing problems in homeroom, but he can be back with you afterwards.”

Although neither of you truly liked the idea, you knew it was the only way. Through the tears, Serene nodded, gave you one last, embracing hug before she handed you over to Mrs. Sytes. She quickly walked back to the classroom and after watching your stricken love walk into the classroom, you quickly spun around and closed your eyes. You felt Mrs. Sytes walk back towards the office with you carefully held in her hands. “We honestly did the best we could to keep you two together the entire day, but no matter what we tried, homeroom was always the bump in the road.” You said nothing, for you felt it was best to keep your emotions sealed inside and say nothing rather than let your emotions out and say the wrong thing. Besides you never really were the one to let your anger get the better of you, or speak what was on your mind. You merely lay deep in your own thoughts as Mrs. Sytes walked into the office and in through Mrs. Flame’s door.

Mrs. Flame immediately looked up to Mrs. Sytes face and then down to yours. “Thank you Sarah. How did they take the news?” Mrs. Sytes just shook her head, conveying the negative emotion shared by you and Serene. Mrs. Flame’s head fell slightly at the response and when Mrs. Sytes set you down on the desk, she immediately left and the room’s atmosphere had not lightened any.

“I’m sure Mrs. Sytes already told you, but we did the best to keep you two together.” Your head was still was facing your feet, but you slowly nodded your head in comprehension. She slowed her breath and after a brief pause, spoke in a quiet tone. “I’m going to try and make this as much of a one-way conversation as possible, to help keep you out of the spotlight. I only ask that you come a bit closer.” You obeyed and slowly walked closer towards the massive figure that sat before you. “I’m afraid things from here on out will be a little more complex, but hopefully not too much. As you have heard, you’re no longer to be in the same homeroom as Serene, but you can be together after that. However there was one little detail we wanted to wait until you were here to inform you of, and that detail is this.”

On the tip of her finger rests a grey cloth, one that was roughly about your height. She motions you closer to take the cloth and you comply. When you take it off her finger and move it around, you recognize the forms of sleeves and shortly after that, the form of a hood. You recognize it as a cloak, but hold it out with a perplexed expression. “It’s for your class with Mr. Necroen. He wanted to have you permanently banned from his class, but we talked him into letting you be there as long as you were enveloped in a cloak. We wish there was another way things could work out, but he’s the only teacher who can teach advanced science and we can’t change his beliefs.” Although you didn’t like the idea of being this grey figure on Serene because of one teacher, at least this was a way to avoid a little grit. You threw on the cloak and noticed its comfort and how it didn’t make you feel at all warm. The cloak offered excellent shade as well as a few internal pockets and a front that could be divided and cast over your shoulders, plus it was that shade of grey you liked. “We know it will be strange to wear this all day, but we made it as pleasant as we could.” You smiled as best as you could manage and gave a bow as a sign of gratitude. She smiled and replied “you’re welcome”.

The bell rings and suddenly, you’re lifted into the air and set on Mrs. Flames shoulder. Feeling a bit unsteady and uneasy, you kneel on her shoulder. Her shoulder was a bit higher than Serene’s, but you quickly adjusted.
