You held on to Mrs. Blaze as she slowly departed from the office and through the hallways. No one was out in the hallways, even when just a few brief minutes ago the bell had rung. Mrs.Blaze said nothing the whole way back to Mr. Necroen’s classroom, but she did seem to walk with a certain determination, as if she was going to save a life. Before she opened the door to Mr. Necroen’s room, she whispered to you “Don’t forget the cloak”. You immediately pull the cloak across your body and the hood over your head.

Mrs. Blaze walks in and greets Mr. Necroen. He replies with a recessed tone and Mrs. Blaze walks to where Serene sits. You look at her from within the hood to see her eyes are dried but not without a mark of past tears. You exhaled as Mrs. Blaze squatted beside Serene’s desk. “Here’s your fellow classmate back. After school today, I’d like to see the both of you, ok?” You move from Mrs. Blaze’s shoulder to Serene’s desk. You and Serene both simultaneously nod. Mrs. Blaze offers a smile and quietly whispers “Everything will be fine”. You make no facial expression as it really doesn’t matter, but Serene half-heartedly smiles at you. Mrs. Blaze turns away, apologizes to Mr. Necroen then walks out of the room. Serene looks down at you, but you look away. She reaches to pull away your cloak hood, but you put your hand up to stop her finger. She gasps, and pulls her hand away.

The class goes by quickly. The class was basically chemistry, but you didn’t pay much attention. In your mind it really didn’t matter whether you gave every second of your life to this class or not a single breath, the teacher didn’t care about you either way. You could be killed and all he would feel is joy. After the bell rang, Serene swept you up and stormed off to her next class. You wanted to say something, but in her current state, it was impossible to determine what was the right or wrong thing to say. You merely watched as she was almost running away from Mr. Necroen’s classroom. She ended up in a large room, one half with desks and the other half with miniature kitchens. Serene sets you down on the desk and walks away. You look at her as she sits in kitchen area, with her eyes once again revealing her hurt.

You were now completely paralyzed. She was letting her emotions fly out, but she didn’t want you anywhere near her. This was a tip, a tip that you had done something wrong. What it was though, you had no clue. You lied down and turned to face the other way. Shortly afterward, however, you were poked in your back. You turn around to see Ashley looking down at you with a concerned face. “What happened?” You sighed and replied “I think I did something wrong. I just have no clue what it is.” Seeming to understand your position, Ashley nods and walks back to Serene. After a brief conversation, Ashley is soon standing over you once again. This time, she picks you up and carries you back to Serene. Serene says nothing, and Ashley takes a seat next to her. Everyone else comes piling in the room almost instantaneously. You don’t pay any attention to who each person is because the only person who matters is the one crying across from you.

In a tone no one else can hear, Ashley tries to settle the issue between the two of you. “So by my understanding, Roy knows he did something wrong, but he has no idea what. Serene, you feel like Roy doesn’t truly like you.” Serene nods and your jaw drops. You instantly reach up to your hood and pull it down. “W-Why would you think that?” Serene just turns away, and Ashley puts you close to her mouth so she can whisper in your ear. “She said last class when you looked away from her and pushed her away, she felt like that was a good enough sign.” Your jaw lowers even more and now you feel terrible. You motion for Ashley to move you closer to her ear. She complies and you whisper what you hoped could clear this whole issue up.

“Let me explain things from my perspective. In homeroom, I was called down to the office and told I can no longer spend homeroom with Serene. Then they gave me this cloak and explained why I need to wear it. They said on Mr. Necroen’s demands I either wear the cloak so he doesn’t have to look at me or I get forced out of the class. When I was dropped back with Serene, I felt terrible knowing I was the cause of this whole issue. I dared not to look at those crystal eyes which I cracked, nor could I let her touch the beast that tore apart her heart. I also thought she was going to pull the cloak away and I didn’t want her to get yelled at by Mr. Necroen.” Ashley pulled you away from hear and looked at you with appalled eyes. “They separated you two from each other in homeroom?!” Serene nodded with a calm nod, having temporarily stopped her tears. “Hey sis, I think maybe I should explain to you what he just told me, because I think your missing one major part.” Ashley sets you down on a nearby table and whispers into Serene’s ear.

After what seems a long time, Serene’s looks at you with a surprised face. You spread your cloak over your shoulders and look up at her with arms spread wide. She immediately presses you into her breasts and starts crying again. You hear whisper “sorry” repetitively, and you just cuddled up to her. When she pulls you up to her face, you decide to make the first move. You cling to her face and say “I love you Serene.” She quickly pries you from her cheek and kisses your torso. “Not as much as I love you Roy.” You two both thank Ashley. “It’s okay. Let’s just hope the other three didn’t see Serene crying and you separated from her.” Your body swells with fear and sure enough when you scout out the classroom, Andrew, Greg, and Matt were all in the class with you. You immediately pull your cloak across your body and the hood over your head, then curl up into a ball. Soon your cloak is pulled away and you notice a familiar pink aura. “They won’t hurt you. Remember, I promised I wouldn’t let them.” The tension you felt slowly faded away and you smiled up to her and gave her a nod in understanding.

You leave the hood down, but pull the cloak back across your body. Serene gazes with questioning eyes, but disregards your actions and sets you on top of her head. Both her and Ashley shift over to another kitchen area. When they take their seats, you notice the teacher walks through the door. His arms are packed with cooking supplies, so his appearance was a bit clouded. Nonetheless, a deep, masculine voice booms from behind the boxes in his hands. “Good afternoon class.” “Good afternoon, Mr. Cullins.” Mr. Cullins set all the boxes on lone table in the kitchen section, and then walked back to the front. That’s when you noticed he had an appearance similar to a Hariyama “I’m sure you all know we have our human student Roy with us today, so after we’re done cooking for the day, you can meet him. Right now, everyone to the kitchen so we can start on our food.” Everyone moved to the kitchen and divided into groups.

Greg, Matt, and Andrew all sat in one area, while everyone else divided up into pairs. Mr. Cullins ordered everyone to grab their supplies and afterwards instructed what they would be working on: Pizza. When Ashley, who went to go retrieve the supplies, came back, both Ashley and Serene instantly opened the boxes and sorted out the supplies. For safeties sake, you climb down from Serene’s head and stood away from the work area and the stove. You looked at everyone cooking, mainly the brothers and the sisters. The brothers were quicker at getting everything together, but the sisters seemed more organized. You noticed everyone almost simultaneously start tossing their pizzas into the air, so you figured it was safe enough and wandered over to the bowl where they mixed the pizza dough. You climb into the bowl and see little bits of dough left over. Pooling together the remnants, you find you have enough to make a pizza your own size. You climb out of the bowl and rip a square off the one of the boxes so it can hold your pizza.

You look over at the groups and see while one person is stirring the tomato sauce, the other person is getting the toppings ready. Then, while Serene is pouring the sauce on her pizza, you slip yours under for a short enough time span to get sauce to coat your pizza. Then you walk away with your pizza and wait for Ashley to start sprinkling the cheese. Nobody in the class seems to notice you, but that was alright with you. Ashley mixes up three different bags of cheese into one and sprinkles it onto her pizza. You grab a strand of each of the flavors, then rip them up as small as you can so the cheese can cover your pizza. Then Ashley and Serene started to add toppings like pepperoni and sausage, but that’s when you gave up with extra ingredients. At some point in time, everybody put their pizza in their ovens. Everybody except one group and that group was Serene’s brothers. They had Greg cook the pizza with his fire breath, then leave it out to cool.

About seven minutes later, Serene pulled out their pizza and set it on the counter to cool. You took advantage of this and laid you pizza on their pan so it would cook without being overcooked in an oven. After a minute or so, you quickly pulled your pizza from their pan onto your cardboard. You took in the scents of all the pizzas and enjoyed most of their fragrances. A few were slightly burnt, and that odor carried through the air as well. Mr. Cullin walked around and examined every pizza. He then cut each pizza into slices and after he was finished, he stood at one end of the room and looked amongst the students.
11521112221212.title: Last classes for the day

115211122212121.content:
Mr. Cullins seemed to be waiting for some momentous event to occur, while everyone else grew either nervous or eager. Finally, a door opened and all eyes shot towards the sound. In through the door walks a Mightyena wearing some reading glasses, Mrs. Blaze, Antonio, and Rose. Each person walking in greeted Mr. Cullins and to each person, Mr. Cullins respectively replied their name back. You overheard Mr. Cullins say the name Mr. Lupinel. “Thank you all for showing up,” Said Mr. Cullins, “Now go ahead and eat.”

Each of the cooking students stood back as one of the guests came around to cut up the pizza. Mr. Lupinel headed towards the opposite end of the room, Mrs. Blaze took a table close to Mr. Lupinel, Antonio took Serene’s brother’s table, and Rose took your table. You watched as Rose carefully cut Ashley and Serene’s pizza. “So how did you get out of class?’ questioned Serene. Rose finished cutting the pizza, then looked up to Serene. “Antonio and I have publishing last hour and since there is no real teacher, we got pulled out of class.” After every pizza had been cut, each guest took a piece and ate it. Each pizza had been sampled by everyone and only twice had someone’s face responded cbitterly to the taste.

After confronting Mr. Cullins and him scrambling something on a sheet of paper, each taster talked to the groups while the groups ate a piece of their own pizza. You looked at your pizza and as it was now beyond cool, tried to figure out a way to eat it. You had no knife and it seemed useless to ask for one. Finally, as seeing no other options, you decided to fold the pizza in half and eat it like that. The taste wasn’t anything amazing, but it was pretty good.

You were in mid-bite when you heard footsteps coming up from behind you. You released the pizza from your teeth and turned around. When you spun around, you saw the towering figure of Mr. Lupinel talking to Serene. “Good afternoon Ms. Serene.” “Good afternoon Mr. Lupinel.” You set your pizza on the cardboard behind you and took a quick look over Mr. Lupinel while he was standing here. He seemed to have a fair build, his glasses were obviously necessary, and the air around him gave a professional, yet free feel. “How are you today, Ms. Serene?” “I am fine and how about you?” “I am well and how is the new student?”

The attention of both of these titans shifts from each other to you. You shift your eyes from Serene to Mr. Lupinel. “He’s alright” Serene said, seeming as though she was entering a deep state of contemplation. Mr. Lupinel extended his hand, more specifically his claw out to you. You took the claw and gave an attempted handshake. After you released his claw, he took a seat and offered Serene to do the same. Serene accepted and after they both had taken a seat, Mr. Lupinel smiled then started up the conversation. “As you know my name is Mr. Lupinel and the subject I teach is creative writing. Serene told me she wished to take my class with you, but she took the course last year. I wish she hadn’t taken it last year though. I would like to see what human students write about. Do you do any free writing?” Although you occasionally wrote a poem, it was not everyday and you rarely wrote anything else, so you shook your head in a “no” motion. He didn’t seem happy, but he gave you a grin. “That’s alright. Some people just love to write and to others, it’s not so natural or pleasant. I must return to my classroom. Until we meet again, farewell.” Serene waved with emotion, but you just raised your hand.

Serene winked at you and went back to talking to Ashley. You quickly turned back around and once again had the pizza in your mouth. Once again footsteps approached your from behind and you put your pizza back on the cardboard. When you turned around this time, Rose’s face was right there. You jumped a little at how close her face was, and after you jumped, she pulled her face away and started to giggle. You obviously didn’t enjoy it as much as Rose did and you sat there looking at her while trying to catch your breath. You then looked to the left of Serene and noticed Antonio standing there looking down at you. You started to fear the massive anthromorphic Latios that stood in front of you, and the only reason was his size.

He seemed the least bit threatening and his face showed of gentleness, but no matter how you put it, his sheer size left you paralyzed. Serene looked over her shoulder and noticed Rose and Antonio looking down to you. “Hi Rose” Rose looked away from you and turned to Serene. “Hi Serene. I thought they should meet each other.” The two of you were locked in a stare down. He stood with crossed arms and you stood in a tense stance. Neither one of you shifted a muscle, and the only movements made were the air you breathed. Serene and Rose looked between you with concern, but you knew what this was all about. This was just another greeting, just one with a bit more grit and less grace. You’d met people back home who did the same thing, just without his size or power. You grinned and slowly loosened up and stuck your hand out for him to shake. He grinned as well and accepted your handshake. “It’s a pleasure to meet you. My name is Antonio.” “The pleasure is mine Antonio. My name is Roy.” Antonio released your hand and looked to his sister. “We should probably get back to writing the papers. Nice to see the both of you.” “Okay. Bye Serene. Bye Roy.” With that, Antonio and Rose walked out the door.

This time you hurried up and ate your pizza. You looked to your side halfway through and saw Serene looking at you somewhat intrigued. You smiled in between bites, but she only looked more curious. Finally, after you had completely eaten, you slowly turned to face her. She looked, but said nothing. “What? I was hungry.” “But what was that?” “A pizza for me.” Serene shook her head and looked around the classroom, seeing Mrs. Blaze heading your way. She stopped at your station and knelt on the ground. “I’ve asked Mr. Cullins if you may leave this class early to come and talk with me and he said you may as long as you clean up your area here first. I’ll be in my office waiting.” You both nodded and Mrs. Blaze walked off. Ashley and Serene did most of the cleanup, and you did the best you could. After all had been cleaned, Serene waved goodbye to everyone. You put the cloak so it was across your chest and over your head, then climbed onto Serene’s shoulder. You waved to Ashley and looked from behind your hood to Serene’s brothers.

Serene walked out of the class and down towards the office. “So how are you doing?” You asked. “Better now that we’ve got everything worked out. How about you, cutie?” “About the same as you. You had me afraid I made a terrible mistake somehow.” “I’m sorry about that. I guess… I guess I jumped to conclusions.” “But why? You know I love you unquestionably.” “Let’s talk about this at home, okay?” “Okay” you finished and Serene picked up the pace slightly and soon she had reached the office. She walked directly in to Mrs. Blaze’s office and took a seat. “Good afternoon Mrs. Blaze.” Mrs. Blaze looked up from whatever she had been reading and focused her attention on you and Serene. “Good afternoon Serene and you too Roy. I hope you two have had an excellent first day.” Serene set you down on the desk and looked at you. You shrugged. “It could have been better, but we can make tomorrow as good as we wanted today.” “That’s a good attitude to have. Is there anything you need from me or the staff?”

Serene pondered a bit and at the same time, you took down your hood. “Well, is there some way where he doesn’t have to wear this?” Serene stated as she pointed to the cloak. “Unfortunately we’ve already done the best we could about that and what you see is that effort.” Serene’s ears lowered and her head did the same. You walked as close as you could and touched her nearby breast in an effort to get her attention. “I’m not gone and this isn’t a way of avoiding people. This is just… a little test of our relationship.” Serene’s eyes instantly shot towards you. “W-what do you mean?” “Um, well, I guess this is just another obstacle we have to overcome and hold on to each other through, kind of like with Jared or… your brothers.” “You think so?” “I guess.” Serene suddenly lit up and gave a big smile. “Then I guess I can’t let you go for a heartbeat.” “Just like I would never let you go.” Mrs. Blaze smiled and spoke up. “You two really do work well together. I asked the teachers what they thought of you and all gave good reports, except for one, but we’ll ignore the one since it did seem a bit… irrational. I’m glad you two work well together and I hope to see this performance in the future.”

Mrs. Blaze looked at a nearby clock, then back at you and Serene. “There’s about five minutes until dismissal, but I think for today, I’ll let you out a bit early. Head home and relax, because tomorrow will be bigger than today was.” Serene smiled and levitated you back onto her head. “Thank you Mrs. Blaze. We’ll be ready tomorrow.” “Good. Bye Serene and bye Roy.” Both you and Serene waved as you walked out of the classroom. Serene then headed out the front door, heading undoubtedly for home.
115211122212121.title: Ending the school day

1152111222121211.content:
The walk home had been swift and eventless, though looking at the scenery proved to be interesting when you really looked at it. There were no streets, no garages, or anything that could be related to vehicles. This world seemed almost lifeless without the sound of a car driving by or looking up and not seeing a single aircraft. Yet, the peace was not unwelcome, nor was the fresher air that came with it.

Finally, you came upon the fortress that Serene called her home. She walked in to the dead-silent home and went upstairs to her room. Serene lied down upon the bed and carefully set you atop her bosom. “So how are you doing?” Serene asked as she delicately ran her finger down your back. Her finger had a way of relaxing you and it felt so good, it took you a moment to respond. Finally you mustered your thoughts and responded. “I’m great. How are you?” “I’m good. Do you want something to eat?” Serene said as she grabbed you, sat up, and set you on the bed. You looked confused and shrugged your shoulders. “Well, I was going to get some tea. How about I bring some for you too?” You nodded in approval and she pressed her fingers to her lips and then to you. She winked as she walked down the stairs.

You crawled down her bed sheets and went over to your personal bathroom. You took care of some personal matters and took a quick but hot shower afterwards. A shower always was a way of helping you to relax and today, it just seemed too perfect. Finally when everything in the bathroom had been attended to, you walked over to Serene’s desk and climbed up it. When you had reached the flat of it, you walked into the miniature house. You got a change of some more comfortable clothes and went over to one of the other duffle bags and sorted through it. Sketch pad, drawing supplies, a book of quotes, laptop and its components… and there it was. You finally found your mp3 player with its new attachment. To protect it, you got a durable case. The only other problem was how to keep it powered and that problem had been addressed too. At the base was an adjustable solar cell, one that collected a fair amount of power and didn’t interfere with its performance.

You hung up your cloak and set your clothes from the day in an organized pile. You threw on the sleeveless tee you had and put on some lounge pants and put in the headphones. Music was always one of your favorite things and you rarely let a second pass where it wasn’t going. But after a loud knocking sound rang out, you shut the music off and took out the headphones. You figured it was Serene, so you wrapped the headphones around the mp3 and set it by your other stuff. But when you went by the door, you saw Serene’s brothers at the entrance of her room. You quickly dropped back into the shadows of the house and pressed yourself against an internal wall. “Serene? Hey, you here Serene?” The voice obviously belonged to Greg, but that had little importance. You stayed in your position and slowed both your heart and breathing in an attempt to blend into the shadows. You heard the brothers walk in the room and you only hoped Serene had the brew done.

Your plea had been answered when you heard a lighter pair of feet climbing the stairs. You peered from around a corner and saw Serene standing at the door with a mug of steaming tea and with an appalled expression. “What do you think you’re doing?!” Serene exclaimed as she went into her room. Her brothers looked surprised and promptly turned around. “Hey Serene. You uh… mind if we talked?” Serene looked furious and set the mug down on a near by table. “Sure. Now tell me what you did to Roy!” Each brother looked to each other. “We didn’t do anything, honest! He wasn’t here when we walked in.” “So Greg and Matt, where’s your books?” Serene asked, obviously trying to repress the hatred that quelled within her. “They’re in our rooms. Why does it matter?” “Because you could’ve grabbed him and set him in either of your rooms with your books. You apparently had enough time.” Then Andrew jumped in.

“But, we didn’t. We wouldn’t do that. We know how much that would hurt you.” Serene walked over to her bed and sat on the edge with one leg over the other and almost in tears, spoke and looked at each individual sibling. “So you wouldn’t steal him because it would hurt me, but you would roast him, or shock him, or poison him with darkness, or scare the life out of him.” Greg, Matt, and Andrew each looked away and showed their shame. “We… weren’t going to hurt him. We were just trying to keep him in line and make sure he didn’t hurt you.” Matt replied, attempting to make eye contact. “He wouldn’t hurt me even if I told him to. We both love each other too much to harm the other. I couldn’t ever hurt him.” Serene looked away and you noticed little glistens rolling down her cheeks. You immediately felt the urge to run over and give her a hug, but you didn’t want to get involved in this fight. Greg tried to wrap her up in a hug, but he was held off by a familiar pink emanation. “The worst thing about this is that you were so convinced I couldn’t choose a good man on my own and you were so afraid of him hurting me physically that you mentally destroyed me. I trusted you to keep your word and be kind to him, but obviously that was more than too much to ask.”

Serene sat there crying, tears pouring as strong and swift as a waterfall. You suddenly felt some rage surge, but you restrained it. Although the source of Serene’s pain was right here, you knew trying to settle the score would only make it worse. So you sat and watched as she slowly calmed down and collected herself. “We’re sorry, but we thought it was best.” Greg said, leaving Matt and Andrew nodding in agreement. “I don’t know if I can forgive you. You hurt me and Roy. I do want to forgive you, but if Roy doesn’t feel he can forgive you, then I can’t either. Roy, if you can somehow forgive them, then please show yourself.”

Now the decision was rested upon your shoulders. Sure, they made a mistake, but were they honest with their little tell-all or was this just a way of them trying to get closer to harm you again? You released yourself from the wall and meditated on the decision at hand. After deep contemplation and doing what was probably best for everyone, you slowly marched out of the shadows of the house and onto the desk. Just as they were all about to walk out of Serene’s room, you crossed your arms and gave a sharp whistle. Everyone turned around but before they were facing you, you looked over to a stunned Serene, smiled and winked, then quickly looked back at the brothers and gave a stern scowl. They too seem surprised by your appearance. Greg quickly started walking your direction and before he got too close, you dropped one foot back. He slowly took another step forward and you stepped backward again. Then he stopped and started to back step.
When he was five steps back you stepped back to where you originally were.

Serene stood up and walked over to the edge of the desk closest to you. “I guess he doesn’t trust you.” With arms still crossed and eyes focused on the brothers, Greg in particular, you walked toward Serene. You stood there and waited for their next move. They started to walk closer and you remained where you were, feeling safe being near Serene. “We’re extremely sorry. Can you forgive us?” You then took this opportunity to see how honest they really were and glared at them, each dead in the eyes. You stared until one of them shook a little and moved onto the next. When you had finally come to Greg, you stared at him almost to the point where he looked paralyzed. Finally when you had gotten the desired results, you stuck your hand out. Greg, Andrew, and Matt all shook it. They then smiled and left Serene’s room. She knelt over and gave you a kiss. “I’m glad you found it in your heart to forgive them, but what if they try to hurt you again?” “Then… then I guess I’m the fool and you will have to get revenge.”

“Well, it’s never going to come to that. I was impressed at how long you stared them down and didn’t show any fear though.” Serene said as she walked across the room to grab the mug of tea. “Well it was quite a change from people my size, but they made you cry and if anything I had to be tough for you.” She kissed you again and poured a little tea into a bottle cap. You took a hearty drink and savored its mild taste.

Both you and Serene sat there, enjoying the taste, when a knock resounded at her door. All eyes shifted, and Andrew was seen holding a notebook. “May I come in?” Serene paused briefly before nodding. Andrew walked in and stood next to Serene’s desk. “I came here to ask Roy a question. While we were in math today, I noticed you had a pretty good understanding of the lesson and was wondering if you would be willing to help me.” You nodded after a brief moment and after Serene moved to make room for Andrew, you began the little tutoring session.

After about an hour or so, Andrew finally understood it nearly as well as you. Andrew said thanks and headed downstairs. Not too long afterwards, Serene’s mom called for dinner and after mounting atop Serene’s head, you went downstairs to the kitchen.
1152111222121211.title: At home

11521112221212111.content:
After about a half hour after you had set down the stairs for dinner you were now going back to Serene’s room. Serene laid down on the bed and set you in the valley between her breasts. After you had settled into a comfortable position, Serene took her index and gently ran it down your back. You let out a relaxed sigh and you started to sway. “I think I ate too much.” You say up to her, and in a cutesy type of voice she responds “Ate too much? But you barely ate anything at all!” You chuckle and nod your head, once again sighing. No matter how often you looked at it, going from such a big guy to the smallest was one of the biggest kicks in the teeth imaginable.

Nonetheless, Serene brought you back to reality with a gentle blast of air. You looked up to her wondrous pools she called eyes and found yours eyes being centered on them. Serene was absolutely beautiful and how you ever got with her is a mystery that may be unsolvable. “Roy… Roy… Roy, are you all right?” You shook your head violently. “Yeah, I’m fine. Just thinking.” “About what?” “About how beautiful you really are.” Through Serene’s blue fur showed a hint of red. “Thanks, but you’re pretty attractive yourself.” “Ah but I am nowhere near as attractive as you. You have a beauty I have never seen before.” Serene’s face this time showed a red so deep it could make the jewel on her forehead fade and she slightly turned her face away. “I’m sorry for embarrassing you. I just wanted to make sure you knew how I felt about you.” “Roy, thank you. I’m glad you can be honest and tell me. But how about you tell me which sense of beauty you’re talking about?” “I wish I could, but I’d like to keep it a secret. It’s not bad in any way, but I think maybe I should tell you later.” Serene’s ears fell a bit, showing obvious disappointment. “Okay. How about you tell me what you thought of today.” “If you really want to hear me blab about it, I will. But only if you tell me about yours afterward.” Serene gave a nod of approval.

You explained to Serene about how all went relatively well, except for Mr. Necroen’s issue. When you said that, Serene interrupted and both exhibited as well as explained her hatred over that situation. You then explained the situation from where she wasn’t present all the way to the point of coming to an armistice with her brothers. There was a note you intentionally kept out of the conversation, the incident at the beginning of cooking. That was dirt that was best left unperturbed, as no one really was better than the other and you in reality were the cause. Serene then explained how she felt about the day and its happenings. She mentioned reading the paper, specifically the article about you and how it didn’t quite sum up how great of a guy you were. You looked down and started to rub your neck. After you reformed your eye contact, Serene started talking about how much fun it was making the pizza and ended on the note of making tea. In your mind you started to cheer, seeing as she too had avoided the topic. Then almost as if feeling a premonition, or in your case an omen, something deep inside whispered in a voice you clearly recognized as your own and said: ‘She is not done talking yet.’

That’s when you started to curse yourself silently, knowing that she was just about to start digging that forbidden turf. “Hey Roy?” “Yes?” You responded, now assured that the conversation was inevitable. “I’m sorry about the beginning of cooking.” “Serene, if anyone should be sorry, it’s me and not you. I messed up, you didn’t.” “But I abandoned you.” “Yes but had I not refused your touch, this would have never occurred.” “But…” “Serene, let’s put it this way. I made most of the errors today. No matter how much you argue about what you did, I won’t change my view. I really don’t want to discuss or debate this anymore. It makes me feel worse both about hurting you and starting a fight. So can you make me the first promise I ask of you, that being you promise not to mention this unless it is absolutely necessary.” She hesitated, but nodded yes after some contemplation.

“Alright.” “Thank you.” You’re welcome. How about first thing tomorrow we stop by Rose and Antonio while they are in the publishing room and pick up an extra paper so you can see what they say about you yourself?” “I guess but when can I read since I don’t have a homeroom? I think Mrs. Blaze is going to engage in conversation rather than watch me read an oversized paper. Maybe you can ‘assist’ me with reading it, since it could take a while reading it alone.” “Good that way I can point out what isn’t quite right.” You buried your face into palm and gently shook your head.

“Could you set me on the desk for a second? There’s some things I need to do.” “Um, okay.” Serene walks you over to the desk, sets you down upon its surface and you walk in. After walking in, you sort through your duffle to find the laptop. After opening it up and turning it on, Serene looked in one of the windows. “What are you doing?” “Well as part of being sent to this world, I’m supposed to kind of keep a log of today’s happenings and explain them to my government.” “So what are you going to tell them?” “Just the basics and everything overall. I doubt personal things would stir their interest.” You spent a quick five minutes typing the list, sent it and within another five minutes you were answering the email they responded with, asking more in-depth questions. You answered them and after receiving a farewell response, shut the laptop down and looked to Serene.

“Well since I’m done with that and I’m still in here, would it be alright if I ask you a question?” “Why would you find it necessary to ask a question in your house here and not out here with me?” “With the tone you had earlier, I feel a little safer asking from in here.” “Wait, when did I… Oh are you going to ask about Jared?” “Indeed I am, unless you still don’t want to talk about it.” “No it’s alright. I guess I got a little aggravated. Jared once went out with Alana for a little while and they seemed great, until Alana found out Jared was cheating and broke it off immediately. Alana being my best friend, I kinda came to dislike Jared as much as she had. A few months later, he played innocent and wanted to go out with me. When I flatly told him no, he kept asking, with a little bit more anger each time. A few weeks later I started talking to you. That’s when I told him we were planning on going out, wether you were going to ask in time or not. He really got infuriated with that, saying how pain and suffering will only come my way by going out with you. He even started to spread rumors about you and me, which is where I think my brothers got their ideals from.”

“NO WE DIDN’T!” Shouted Greg from the other side of the door. You instantly chuckle and Serene looks at you confused. “You know I don’t know what’s worse about this, that Greg’s lying or that he’s actually eavesdropping on our conversation.” Serene shook her head in shame. “Greg why are you eavesdropping on us? I gave you a chance to talk with Roy and you abused it. You mad bro?” You looked at her with an empty face and start climbing down her desk. She looks at you confused and when you look back, you give her a sign that something doesn’t sound right. While Serene and Greg were carrying on a conversation, you crawled under the door and barely wedge yourself between the carpet and the door. That’s when you noticed 3 sets of feet, one black, one yellow and the other red. You pulled back into Serene’s room and dashed over to her desk and she gave you a lift up. You shook your head and she shot a look that demanded an explanation. You filled her in and she decided to let them in on their own bust. “Greg, when was the last time you went to the doctor?” “Last month. Why?” “Well Roy’s in here worried about you. He says growing two other pair of feet each with a different color seems unhealthy even here.” “What are you talking about?” “C’mon, he says he saw all of you out there. Just admit it.” “We were going to say goodnight, but I heard Jared get mentioned and I got curious.” Andrew confesses. “So since we’re here, how about you explain what happened in Ms. Passel’s class” Greg says. “We’re about to go to bed though. Either wait until tomorrow or have Andrew explain it.” Soon enough the footsteps thundered away and Serene carried you over to the bed. “Goodnight Roy.” “Goodnight Serene.” Shortly after that you two had both drifted off.

Your sleep was short lived, however as you woke up. You looked around and noticed the moonlight still pouring into the window. You cautiously climbed off Serene and her bed and progressed towards the desk. You slipped into your house to grab your mp3 and walked to the window sill. You put the headphones in, played some music, and sat down, gazing at the full moon. You knew you were going to wake up again tonight as you had last night. Thoughts had been in your head all of today and yesterday, you just shoved them out in hopes of a more positive attitude. Even with your best effort, they seeped into your active thoughts. 115211122212121112.content:
You knew subconsciously the day was coming, but you tried to deny it. Finally you reached the point where no effort could keep you asleep. Yet your alarm was not the bright sun, nor the sweet melody of your love. You awoke to a gentle drumming melody, one you easily recognized as rain. You sat up and saw Serene’s window coated with gentle streams of water. You felt something was off and when you examined your surroundings, you noticed Serene was no longer beneath you. You climb down her bed and walk over to your bathroom. You finished your business and nearly walked out when you paused at the sound of running water and a familiar voice singing. It seemed hard to accept, but you were going out with a towering beauty that was both kind and held beauties that went unseen, but certainly not unnoticed.

You walked away from your bathroom and climbed up to the desk’s surface. You threw on some clothes for school and put the cloak on last. Finally you did a quick check over and walked out and scurried down the desk and over to the doorway. You walked out and almost started to walk towards the bathroom when immense tremors shook you. You looked over to the source and noticed they were moving in your direction. You plastered yourself to the wall and waited for the person to pass by. When the owner of the feet had passed by you slid back into Serene’s room. ‘Note to self, don’t wander the house alone, unless you want to become part of the carpet.’ You thought as you climbed onto Serene’s bed to wait for her.

After a few minutes, a relaxed Serene walked in and sat on the edge of her bed. She smiled down to you, then lifted you onto her shoulder. “Are you ready, Sir Roy?” You shook your head in confusion. “Wait what? Why are you calling sir?” “Well knights from your world always had sir at the front of their names and since you were acting so chivalrous last night, you’re my little knight.” “But knights don’t wear cloaks and they ride horses, not beautiful girlfriends.” “Well you’re unique then since you do have a cloak and don’t think of it as riding me, think of it more as traveling with the damsel you so valiantly helped.” “I’d keep debating this with you, but I feel it would be a waste of time and I’d end up losing.” “Glad you know I’m right. Now let’s go get something to eat.”

Serene walked down the stairs and took her place at the table amongst her parents and siblings. Ashley seemed joyous for some odd reason, but when you looked at Greg, he seemed angry. Today’s breakfast: Cereal. “You know I think I’ll pass on the cereal and take some toast instead.” Serene thought about it for a second, then giggled a bit, then psychically grabbed a piece of toast. She broke a corner off and you nibbled away. When you finished, you sat upon Serene’s shoulder. Then you felt as though you were slipping and when you adjusted, you noticed a pink aura seemed to be nudging you. You finally fell off, and was caught barely an inch from the white liquid. You were levitated back onto Mount Serene, but you gave her a dirty look. “You know, just because I’m being nice doesn’t mean you have to be mean.” “I’m sorry. I just wanted to mess with you a bit.” “I know but is there some way less… uncommon. I don’t think many people as a joke get a milk bath. Besides, if anything, I need to mess around some more.”

Everyone said their goodbyes, set their dishes in the sink, and went about their day. You laid down on Serene’s shoulder to avoid being knocked off by the bombarding rain. The cloak splashed most of the rain off, so you kept fairly dry. Ashley now had gone from generally joyful to basking in the rain almost as if it were sunlight. Greg however kept cursing the rain, and started sprinting through it. Eventually the rain picked up and everyone starting sprinting, even Ashley.

Finally everyone went in the school and they tried to pat out the water from their fur. You, however, decided to shake like a wet dog. Little bits splashed on Serene, but you patted them down by rubbing her soft fur. Greg stormed off presumably to his first class, and everyone else slowly went about their days. Serene, true to her word, headed for the publications office and knocked as soon as she came upon the door. Rose answered with a puzzled look, and when Serene explained the situation she grabbed an extra copy. After engaging a brief morning conversation, Serene headed off for battle strategies.

Shortly after Serene took seat, the bell rang and Mr. Shartney began his lecture. “Alright class. Now the last time we met, we were discussing how to effectively use attacks where you have the upper hand. But today I’ll teach you about if your opponent isn’t weak to your attacks or has the upper hand against you. So, for example, what am I weak against?” “Ground!” “Correct. So I’m weak only to ground types. That’s the obvious part, but what if I’m going up against a… Whiscash, for example. I have the advantage, but I also have the disadvantage. Electric is great against water, but useless because of the ground, so what should I do?” “Use a TM and learn a grass type attack.” “That would work in theory, but the only problem is that I may not be able to learn grass type attacks. Any other ideas other than TM use?” The classroom remained silent. “That was a good idea. However the other way that may be simpler in my mind and just as efficient is to use the environment around you.” Mr. Shartney paused then continued.

“With the situation I supplied, it’s difficult to see how that would work and in all honesty, even with determination and a cunning strategy, you may not stand a chance. I could win because I’m that good though.” The class broke into laughter, knowing he meant it as a joke. “Alright, now let’s say Bailey is wandering through the mountains, minding her own business, when a Camerupt decides Bailey is intruding on its space. Bailey knows no water moves, ground moves, or rock type moves. What should she do?” “Run away.” The whole class starts laughing. “While I appreciate the creativity, I don’t want to keep adding restrictions. So if she were to fight, how would she?” Nobody answered, and you were curious to see what they think. “Ok I’ll say it one more time. Bailey, a grass type, is in the mountains fighting a fire type. Now remember what I said earlier and think.” After a few minutes of silence, Mr. Shartney spoke up again. “Well you know I like to give you all opportunities to answer or not to answer, but this is just getting to be a waste of the time we have. So I’m going to ask one specific student. Roy, I’m asking you to think like a pokemon right now and explain what you would do.”

You quietly utter a few syllables. All eyes are on you and the pressure’s on. You think hard, then tell Serene what to say. “Roy says he would use some grass attack on the mountain until a rockslide started. The class looks stunned and Mr. Shartney looks pleased. “That is the answer I’ve been waiting for. Good job. Now for those who don’t understand his way of thinking or you think he’s wrong, let’s look at this in a more physical manner.” Mr. Shartney goes over to the chalkboard and starts drawing. “Here is Bailey, the Camerupt, and the mountain. Bailey attacking directly wouldn’t do much good obviously, so she has to think a bit more in-depth. Bailey normally wouldn’t attack a mountain because, well, it seems stupid, which is why most would overlook it as an option. But by what Roy pointed out, if she attacked enough or hit the right spot, a rockslide could potentially come and make the Camerupt faint. Either that or run away because she seems insane. That’s the main idea of today’s lesson. It won’t work everywhere or every time. Now on the board, I’m going to put a few more examples and I want you all to answer them as one big group."

Mr. Shartney grabs the chalk and writes three examples: Mrs. Taoshen in a frozen land against a Pidgeot, Serene fighting Andrew, a Lanturn versus a Relicanth. Everyone discussed the answers amongst themselves and after a few moments answered. “I thought Mrs. Taoshen could use an Aura Sphere and watch the Pidgeot crash into the ice.” I thought she would pick up a snowball and launch it at the Pidgeot.” “I think Andrew would be afraid of Serene and run away. I know I would.” Serene chuckled as everyone laughed. “I think Serene should probably punch or kick him.” “I think that we should go home and see how they work it out.” “Everyone once again roared with laughter. “For the last one, I think it would be best to swim to the bottom and use a tail slap with mud.”

“Good work today class. You’ll be off to Mrs. Taoshen to learn how she would deal with a Pidgeot in the snow. Also, as a reminder, tomorrow we will have guests during class. Be on your best behavior, especially Roy and Serene.”

The bell rang and sure enough, everyone was off to Battle Applications. “What do you think he meant by ‘Especially Roy and Serene’ ”? I don’t know, but I hope it’s not a bad thing. I don’t think we did anything wrong. Maybe it’s just the guests have something to do with us. Whatever it may be, we should be fine, Mr. Genius.” “What is that supposed to mean?” “Well you answered a question no one could think of an answer for and that shows you’re smart. How I got lucky enough to be paired with you I’ll never know.” “You’ve got it all wrong if you think that way. I’m paired with a girl who’s smart, caring, beautiful, and powerful. All you got is a little man that is smart and was strong back in his own world, but now needs your help just to survive.” “Stop making yourself sound pathetic. I’d rather have you than anyone else in this world and with you being so small, we can always be together.” “That’s true. I don’t want to be apart from you, but what if our love has a fallout like yesterday.” “Well then, like you said, this a test of true love.” “I’ve got to think more before I speak. Well my lovely lady, let’s go watch a few battles.”

Serene reached over, grabbed you and planted a kiss over your cloaked torso. She set you back atop her shoulder and walked into the gym. The class flew by, having about 4 battles, and the final fight was between Serene and Alana. You sat all alone, when you were picked up by black paws. You noticed it was Mrs. Taoshen, and she set you on her shoulder. “I see Serene and you make an excellent team. I think it’s because of you she got so strong, feeling she was fighting to prove her love. How have things been with you personally?” “Fine.” You replied timidly. “Not much of a talker. That’s alright. I’ll make what I need to say brief. I know there’s not much you can do in class, but I need to test your strength somehow. I don’t want you to get hurt, but otherwise there is not much you can do. Today I have to test you. It’s going to be dangerous, but you’ll overall be fine if you use your head. I was told by one of our leaders to test you in a harsh manner, but I’m going to lighten up a tad for safety reasons. What’s going to happen is that I will throw you in the air and you will have to land. Your strength will be determined based upon injuries. The less you have, the better you are.” You freeze, and look at her with fear. “I know what you’re thinking, ‘but I might die or break my limbs’. I know, I thought of this and talked it out with the leader, trying to make him see it as it really is, but I couldn’t change his mind. He swore that nothing would happen and just in case something did, get a nurse on the scene immediately.” “But… d-death can-can’t be cured.” “Then Serene will have to make sure you’re safe. But if she helps, you fail. I’ll tell her.”

Mrs. Taoshen went over to the tired, but victorious Serene and began describing the situation. “But Mrs. Taoshen, I won’t let this happen. I will stop you from doing that.” “Serene please try…” You cut her off, knowing your words will mean the most to her. Mrs. Taoshen passes you over to Serene as you start talking, then starts to explain what’s happening to everybody else. “Serene, I know this is dangerous. I’ve already thought of all the odds. But Serene, think of two things: everyone else and the positives.” “What could be positive about this and what does everyone else have to do with this?” “Well if I succeed, I pass and you’re dating a guy who’s smart and strong. If I fail, I tried and if the worst does happen, I’ll be the strongest and will pay you back by taking care of you, even from beyond the grave.” But…” “And everyone else will be affected because if I don’t do this or have some interference, Mrs. Taoshen and any other staff member could lose their job, plus you may lose your place as a student and your knowledge shouldn’t be lost.” “But I can’t go on without you. You know that.” “Yes and neither could I, but this is another one of those tests but not for love or loyalty, but belief. I need you to believe I can do this. With you believing in me, I can do anything, and I do mean anything. In my world, this would be a leap of faith for me, because I need to believe I can make it, but for you it’s a belief I can fight the battle and win, as your hero. So, Serene Variform, I must ask: Will you believe in me and grant me the strength to succeed?” “I… I will. But what should I do if the worst does happen?” “Do as you have done before with troubles: Push on and be strong, live as though I were never there. You are strong and will continue. Besides I won’t fail, remember belief and trust in one another and we will be stronger.”

Serene tries to smile through her concerned tears, and you can’t help but worry yourself. Serene passes you over to Mrs. Taoshen. “Roy, I will throw you in that direction. Would you prefer to be facing up or down?” “Up.” You reply, with no fear or uncertainty in your voice, although you were afraid. She throws you slightly upward. And when you start to fall down, you roll over and use the cloak on your shoulders as a form of wings and glide closer to the dirt. But when you were about 16 feet (in your terms) away from the ground, you lose grip one of the flaps. At the last second, you shift and start running on the wall vertically. Eventually, you feel gravity start to show and you jump down to land in the dirt. Everyone gasped as the cloud of dust shielded their view of your landing.

The dust swirling in the air around you grew heavy at first, and seemed to obstruct any hope of seeing your spectators. You started to cough a little as the dust got in your mouth and as the cloud dust slowly settled, the trembles of massive footsteps signaled someone’s approach. Judging by the how close the vibrations were, the person was running and even before a blue paw gently wrapped around you, you could tell Serene was the individual heading your way. When Serene picked you up to her face, you turned the other way to cough up the rest of the dust left in your mouth. “Are you ... alright?” Serene asks, showing unmistakable fear and concern. “Yeah, except for a mild soreness and getting a mouth full of dirt.” Serene said nothing as she tightly nestled you between her breasts. She slowly relieves the pressure she applies as Mrs. Taoshen and Mr. Kainen approached

“I’m surprised you even went on with it, but you did. Nice job.” Mrs. Taoshen said as Mr. Kainen nodded in agreement “Mrs. Taoshen, why would they make Roy to do such a crazy test even though they knew the risks?” “I wish I knew Serene, but they said nothing as to the logic behind it. They just assured this test was necessary.” Serene once again embraced you tightly and continued to hold you tightly even after the bell had rung.

You saw light once again as Serene released you from her fleshy mounds and set you on a desk in Ms. Passel’s room. You looked up to her eyes and saw tears still remained. “Please stop crying. The more you cry, the more I feel like I might cry and I don’t have anything to cry about.” “But I almost lost you and why, because some idiot doesn’t care what happens to you. Besides your reasons make me worried.” “Serene, we can’t do anything about the person. What’s done is done. But what do you mean my reasons worry you? Do you think I did this just as a way of getting away from you?” Serene just looked the other way with no sign of denial. “Serene…” You stood paralyzed for a few moments, unsure of how to think. You were known to be untrusting at times but her lack of trust seemed cold-hearted. “Why would you think that?” You noticed the words seemed to just fall out of your mouth rather than being said. “Because others lie to get what they want. Even though those people aren’t that close to me, their words left a sort of scar. What if I’m just some trophy to you?” “But I thought we already discussed this: I’m not like other people. I don’t act or think like most guys. My world had guys that were just after women for their bodies too. Serene, I know it’s not easy, but I want you to trust me and see me as unique, because every other time things like this happen, they usually end worse, like yesterday. So how about since we have some more time, let’s talk. What made you worry this time?” “Well it was some insane stunt where you could’ve died and your reasons seemed like lies. So could you explain them once more so maybe I can see it from your point of view?”

“Ok then. I took the test for a bunch of reasons. I already told you about the pride and benefits for others and to prove our relationship strength. When I agreed to take the test, I also knew that gravity would affect me less because I was so small and I would probably land softer, plus this cloak could help me glide to safety. All that is the truth, but there was one part I left out for… personal reasons. The one thought that had the greatest impact before my decision was what if I said no and what would happen to us.” “What does that mean? You would’ve have been guaranteed safe and I would be happier.”

“Maybe, but what I was thinking was completely different. What I was wondering was how would your government respond. Sure they could’ve just ignored it, but what if there was some major reason for the test and by refusing to take it, I would not be allowed here. In other words, even though I have to be here, if that test had a meaning and I didn’t want to take it, they could have major restrictions or send me back to my world for refusing to cooperate.” “Stop. You’re just saying stuff to try and cover yourself. Why would one test affect you so much that you would have to go back to your world?” “I know it seems far-fetched, but I don’t know how things work here, and in my world, refusing to take a test could point to signs of committing a crime or guilt, which could get you sent away from home. So while that was a rare chance, it was one I didn’t want to risk experiencing. If they did send me back, I couldn’t have been with you anymore and I don’t know if I could live with that. So I agreed to take the test because either way the worst option was death.” “Hold on. What do you mean the worst option was death?” “Well if I had fallen and died, I would be physically dead. However if I had refused to test and they did something, like separate us for health hazards or send me back for a lack of cooperation, then I would metaphorically die. As bad as it may sound, I would rather live with you as a spirit then live without you. Besides like I said, odds were in my favor so death physically would be less likely.”

Serene laid her head on her hand and sighed. “I don’t what to say. I want to call you smart because you thought it all out, but I also want to call you an idiot because you would suspect something so far out there and do something so stupid just to be with me.” “Serene, you said yourself you don’t think you could live without me. Besides if I’m an idiot, I’m your idiot.” Serene looked stuck in emotion. She was smiling, but looked like she might start crying. She wiped away her unshed tears with her arms and smiled even bigger. “I’m sorry. I know you don’t want me to cry, but I can’t help it. It just feels so strange, knowing how much you would give up just to be with me. I guess that’s what love is.” “I don’t know, but it feels right. I just hope you realize how much I really love you.” “I do now. I guess I assumed you might start to act like other guys once you got comfortable.” “Well I don’t think either of us would enjoy that.” “Exactly. I love you cutie.” “Not as much as I love you.”

The bell finally rang after what felt like a half hour even though the clock showed only five minutes. Serene apparently felt the same way by the grin she flashed at you. “Dialga must be on our side. And just for the record, you’re too smart to be an idiot.” You chuckled as you climbed onto Serene’s shoulder. Ms. Passel started the lesson and when you looked behind you, Jared’s seat was empty. “I think Jared got kicked out.” You whispered into Serene’s ear. Then like she was in your mind, she whispered “Maybe but chances are he’s just home reflecting on what he’s done and talking with people like his parents and Lieutenant Ampren.” “I’ll ask who he is later, but for now, I’m not sure whether to be amazed or scared.” “It’s just telepathy. Why? Do you think I’m delving into your thoughts?” “I really wasn’t sure, but it did feel a bit creepy.” “Whatever. I’ve never felt what it’s like. Anyways, I’m going to get back to the lesson. We can talk about who is all in town during ho… I mean after school.”

You decided not to say anything this time. She already probably had some bad thoughts brewing about the separation at homeroom. So you sat and paid attention to the whole lecture, but on occasion looked over at Andrew. He seemed to understand the concepts better. It was nice to know you didn’t have to help such a massive being when you were smaller than his finger, but then again, it also was kind of cool knowing he would listen to you. Regardless, as if Dialga was indeed manipulating time in your favor, the class flew by.

Serene walked to lunch with what felt like a slightly hurried pace. She set you down at her table and walked with all her friends up to the lunch line. Only one person sat with you and that was Mathias. A look on his face seemed to point to an internal struggle, but he was soon near where you stood. “Thank you” he said slightly looking towards you. “Uh… F-for what?” You replied with a hint of fear and uncertainty. “For setting me up with Alana.” “That’s all? I know it’s a big deal, b-but still.” “Well it’s just I’ve been wanting to go out with her for years, but never could find the words. Then out of the blue she wants to go out with me thanks to you. I feel like I owe you.” “But that was just because she was looking for someone like me and I heard you were like me. If we are alike as they think they I know what it’s like to be without someone perfect like Serene or in your case, Alana. Besides, I owe you for math yesterday.” “Well I… I did that because you looked like you needed a hand.” “But helping versus saving. I would owe you immensely and I don’t know if I could do that in 2 lifetimes. So could please just call it even?” “Deal.” The iron giant stuck out his massive finger, to which you grabbed with both hands and shook.

“What are you two doing” rang in your mind as you jumped in surprise. You look around and what looks to be days away stands Serene standing in line for food, staring in your general region. “Everything alright there?” Mathias asked. “Yeah, just something in my head.” He looked the other way and shrugged. As soon as all the girls got back to the table, Cecilia looked at you with a mischievous grin. Her look stirred intimidation so you cringed as Serene took her seat. “W-w-what?” “Nothing bad, little Comran.”

Is that true?” The vixen smiled as she flashed her tails as a peacock would it’s feathers. “These tails? Yes, there is truth to that tale. However, you have not heard all there is to tell. Yes, touching one will result in being cursed, unless the tail touches you first or the touch is minimal, such as someone unintentionally brushing up against it. If a tail touches you first, then you may touch it all you want. Such as this.” She moved one of her tails to you and rubbed it against you. Hesitantly, you reached out to touch it. Once your hand was completely on, you slowly stroked it. It felt soft and very fluffy. “See no harm done.”

You then stopped petting her tail and she retracted it. “So what else would you like to know?” Vienna asked. “Do you have… a boyfriend?” You silently cursed yourself. That question was just awkward. Who asks a friend of your love if they have a companion, especially when they are bigger than you? No matter what her status, she could get offended. “My, an odd question, but certainly not unwelcome. Yes, however he does not attend this school. There is a town a few miles away that he goes to school at. He is a Zoroark, a bit on the hard side, but really nice. Any more questions?” “N-no.”

“Alright then. My turn. So how are things with Serene and her family?” “I get along well with Serene and Ashley, as for her brothers, we’re umm… working on it.” “Got a bit protective of Serene when they met you? How far did they go? I can’t imagine their actions going farther than just yelling, what with you being so small. You don’t mind me tagging you as small, do you?” “I don’t care as much anymore. At first it was kind of a shock, but I’m adjusting. As for your mention of their actions, then you would be surprised. But I’d rather not talk about it.” “Why? Do you bear scars they gave you?” “Not as much physically as mentally. But they certainly did have some ideas to physically harm me. You should really ask Serene. I’m still traumatized by the event. Just don’t bring it up to them. I think it’s best if we all forget it happened.”

Vienna seemed to agree. “Well the bell is about to ring. It was nice being with you for the time we had.” “As it was with you. Perhaps we can be lucky enough to do this again.” Vienna giggled. “I hope Serene doesn’t mind you flirting with me.” Your face grew extremely red. Were you really flirting? “Bu-but I d-d-don’t think that I w-…” You were cut off when Vienna put her finger close to your mouth. “I’m just joking with you. I don’t think we would be talking if you were cheating on Serene. Though I do want you to know I think it’s great Serene is with you and vice versa. You two were made for each other.”

The bell rang and you climbed atop Vienna’s hand. Before Vienna walked out the door, an obviously female Rhydon walked out the door and she caught your attention. But something about her just seemed wrong. She had a headstrong strut, her face seemed to exhibit anger, and she looked bigger than everyone else. However, you quickly dismissed this abnormality. The only thing that mattered right now was that you were nowhere near her and you were on your way back to Serene.

Vienna casually walked back to class. Her paced seemed slow, as though she despised science. Or maybe it wasn’t the class, but rather not getting to spend any more time with you. But what’s bad for her is good for you. Although Vienna was good company, she couldn’t compare to Serene. You started moving your arms to stretch when you realized you had the cloak on. It seemed like that cloak sometimes would just be gone in the blink of an eye.

Vienna walked into Mr. Necroen’s class, set you down at Serene’s desk, and walked over to her seat. Serene snuck a quick kiss in on you before Mr. Necroen walked in. You quickly sit atop Serene’s head and honestly, paid no attention. What did you have to lose? Regardless the lecture flew by, just like the rest of the day, except it seemed even faster. Then Serene darted out as quickly as she could. She made her way to cooking class and set you down on the table where she worked. Everyone walked in shortly afterward, and oddly enough, every seemed to be moving at different speeds, from slowly walking to almost sprinting.

When class started, everyone was originally in the back, waiting in the cooking area. However, Mr. Cullins did not walk through the door, but in his place walked a younger looking teacher. “Hello class. Mr. Cullins could not come in today, so I will be subbing for you today. In case you don’t know my name, I am Ms. Hydrose.” Ms. Hydrose was surprisingly a Buizel and seemed a bit smaller than some of the students. “So class, Mr. Cullins informed me that in his absence, you all should make any meal of your choosing. However I need to see Serene and… Roy at the front of the class.”

Everybody got all the things they needed for whatever it is was they were making. You climbed back atop Serene’s hand and she walked to the front of the room. “Hello Ms. Hydrose.” “So you’re … Serene Variform? That would make you Ashley’s sister then?” “Yep. We work together back there.” Serene waved to Ashley and she waved back. “She keeps me entertained in class. Great student. Anyway, where is this Roy fellow?” “I’m right here.” Ms. Hydrose looked around, then to the ground and after looking around towards the ground notices you looking up. “Oh my! You mean the Roy in this class is the human Roy?!” You just bob your head in assurance. “Why wouldn’t it be this Roy?” “Well there’s so many dangerous things in here and he’s so delicate. But if you’re anywhere near as good as your sister, I’m sure he’ll be fine. Anyway, the office asked me to send you two down. What a relief it’s you two. I was afraid you were a couple caught doing inappropriate things.”

Your face loses all emotion and Serene kind of giggled. “Ok. We’ll see you later.” You wave and Ms. Hydrose waved back. Serene walked out of the room and slowly made her way to the office. “She didn’t know who I was…” You kind of trailed off and looked down towards the distant ground. “Are you getting an ego?” “Well maybe, but I just figured everyone would know about me.” “No you aren’t. But she didn’t know me either until she saw my last name, so we are in the same boat.”

Serene walked further down the hall and as she set you on her shoulder, one of those regrettable questioning thoughts popped into your head. You thought about whether to ask her or not, but in the end decided you would ask. “Serene, do you mind if I ask you a serious question?” “I guess.” “Do… do you love me?” Serene stopped in her tracks and the only thing that was moving was you through the air. “What did you just ask?” “D-do you love me?” “Of course I love you.” “But do you love me because I’m small and easily manipulated or because of whom I am?” “Why are you asking me such weird questions? Do you think I’m just using you or something?” “No it’s not paranoia, it’s… I guess it’s uncertainty and confusion. I mean my world didn’t seem to like me as much as people here, and people here like me mostly because of my uniqueness. But you don’t like me just because of my size or species, do you?” “Of course not. I mean I do think it’s cool that you’re not my size and you’re human, but there’s more to you than just appearance. Physically we share almost nothing in common. But inside you’re like anyone else, so why wouldn’t you think I love you for you? Did you never feel affection from others in your world?” “I experienced it. But the dislike showed more often from others. Or maybe they showed affection in ways I could not understand.”

Serene didn’t say a word, but embraced you in a deep hug. “Roy, you’re the only man I want. No one else can fill you’re place in my heart. If I didn’t love you, I would’ve never wanted to be dating you. We both love each other, because we’ve each struck down the doubt. So let’s stop worrying and embrace each other. Let’s get the office before they start worrying.” She released you from her breasts and set you back on her shoulder. You felt a joy you recognized as love and how it removed the pains you felt. Well, except for the physical pains that had started creeping over you. They felt unnatural, but they only hurt for a few seconds and were not at all often.

Serene walked into the main office and knocked on Mrs. Blaze’s door. The Typhlosion opened the door and seemed relieved. “We were worried you two weren’t coming. Well let’s come in and discuss what needs to be discussed.” Serene took a seat, greeted Mrs. Sytes who sat next to Mrs. Blaze, and awaited some sort of opening statement. “So have the two of you been doing well?” “Yes we have been.” “Good now what we need to talk about is tomorrow. I’m sure you were informed this morning of guests coming tomorrow. Serene, you know what we are talking about when we say guests.” “A bit, but Mr. Shartney said Roy and I need to be on our best behavior. I don’t know what he meant by that.” “Well he’s a chance to get two birds with one stone. Roy, whenever we mention having guests come to visit, it means we have some of our leading officials come in and check on our teaching. However because you are not of this world and all care greatly for your safety, there will be a one extra specifically watching over you and Serene, so you both do need to be on your best behaviors.” “So are we supposed to follow our regular schedule or discuss how we feel it works?” Mrs. Sytes decided to answer this time. “According to what we have been told, it will be a mixture of those two. However, they will not try to bother either of you too much.

In the hallway the bell rang, but Serene held her spot. “Serene we want you here earlier tomorrow in case they decide there are things they need to privately discuss. Other than that, the only thing I have to say although you know it anyway: Be on your best behavior. Now go home and enjoy yourselves.” “Ok. Bye Mrs. Blaze. Bye Mrs. Sytes.” Serene waves for the both of you and heads out the door.
