Serene casually walked out of the office and headed to her locker. After opening it, she grabbed the newspaper she had grabbed and headed back towards the main doors. Just before her hand pushed them open, the bell signaled freedom and the halls were now awake with the sounds of pounding feet. You both however were outside and Serene levitated you to her head.

“So where do you want to go first?” She asks. “How should I know? This is your hometown, not mine. The only places I know here are your bedroom, your kitchen and parts of the school.” Serene just gave a cutesy giggle. “I know, but I just wanted to see if you had a place in mind. Hm, well let’s go see Lieutenant Ampren. There were a few people who wanted to meet you when you got here and he was one of them.” Serene started heading off in one direction and you grew curious with how things were here. “So I never asked this before, but what’s crime like here?”

“Well to be honest crime almost doesn’t exist here. People don’t usually try to steal, murders really can’t happen, and any of those other crimes never happen. The most common thing we have to deal with is fighting, but that’s not really a problem.” “So there’s basically no crime. But how? And if there’s no crime, then why have police officers?” “Well as kids we were told that if we were to even think evil thoughts, Arceus would come for us. As to how true that is, I don’t know but it obviously works. Besides with leaders like Arceus, Rayquaza, or anyone else of that status, there’s no way a crime could happen. They would know about it before it happens. As for police, the most common thing they take care of is unnecessary fights.” “Unnecessary?” “Yeah. Here if you have a problem with someone you can physically fight it out, but you have to let them know first. Otherwise it’s considered unnecessary.” “Oh I see.”

Soon Serene was standing in front of a single story building with double barred windows. Serene pushed the door open. She carefully walked in and looked around. The building seemed to be divided into two halves: the prison cells and the officers’ rooms. Serene obviously veered towards the rooms and stopped at the first room. The nameplate above the door read Nikola Ampren. Inside was a fairly empty office with very few things other than a desk and some cabinets.

Serene peeked in, then moved onto the next room, which belonged to a Thomas Flame. Behind the desk sat a fairly large Arcanine who seemed focused on his work. That is however until Serene knocked on the door frame. He looked up and they talked for what seemed like ages. You quit listening and started to look around the room and noticed a picture that had Tom, whom could be assumed a s his wife, and two daughters, one an Arcanine and the other a Growlithe. The youngest Arcanine looked familiar, but you couldn’t put your finger on where you had seen her before. “Roy, this is Mr. Flame, second in command.” You looked ahead and there he was standing in front of you. “Howdy Roy. I’m Tom.” You reached both hands to shake his finger. “I’m sure you noticed that family photo. That’s me, my daughters Marie and Violet, and my wife Diana.” That’s when you remembered the Arcanine, Violet was in your science class.

“Well I’ll see you later. Go see the chief. He’s been an eager Bidoof about meeting Roy.”

“Oh, okay. Bye.” With that Serene left Mr. Flame’s presence and walked towards Lt. Ampren’s room. She stood in the doorway and knocked. “Ey! Who be knocking at me door?” The Lieutenant looked up from the papers which he had been so focused and smiled when he saw Serene. “Well if it ain’t the lucky lass Serene. You bring the little lad with you?” Serene, flashing a gentle smile, gently nods in approval. “Well what are you doing standing there. Let me see him.” Serene took a seat across from the chief and carefully picked you up with her hand. She set you on the desk and you stood there. The chief stuck his head in real close and carefully examined you. “He be a wee little lad. You got to be delicate, but I see he’s in your careful hands.” He then shifted his attention from Serene to you. “Hello there Roy. My name is Marco. It’s a pleasure to meet you.” He reached a finger out for you to shake. You shook with both hands the finger of the older Manectric. Indeed he wasn’t exactly young. His yellow hair appeared faded and his voice sounded like an old Scottish man. “I’m glad that you’re a respectable human. I would hate to try and arrest someone your size. I probably should let you two be on your way. Lots to do, the two of you.”

“Well it’s nice to see you again, Lt. Ampren. We’ll let you get back to what you were doing.” You climb on Serene’s shoulder, then up to her head. “Please. I rarely get work anymore. The only case I’ve had for months was with that Shiftry child and that barely had any involvement on my part. Come by again sometime. It’s nice to see non-officers come here. I’ll see you around.”

Serene backed away and as she turned around, she collided with another Manectric. You weren’t at all prepared and fell off her head. You fell for a ways before grasping onto her hair. However the silkiness of her hair made it hard to stay in one place or climb up. Eventually you came to a stop and just held on, knowing any other movements could make you fall even further. “Sorry about that Serene.” “It’s alright Nikola. We’ll see you later.” “Yep. Bye.”

Serene got moving again and she hadn’t even noticed your absence from atop her head.
When she had gotten outside, you decided this was enough hanging around for a while and you started to shout to her. However she quickly turned her head and her hair flipped sending you even farther down her hair. Eventually your yelling told her you were in her hair. Her hair become surrounded in a pink and almost seemed to be combing through it and when it came to you, the aura seemed to dissipate and surround you. You were lifted to her open hands. “Are you okay?!” You took a second to catch your breath, then answered. “I’m not really sure.” “Well let’s go grab some of that creamed ice I promised.”

Serene started walking towards an area of the town that had what appeared to be a lot of stores. She walks into one with a hanging sign that had what appeared to be ice cream on it. She walks in and behind the counter stood a Miltank. “Serene, is that you hon? Ain’t it just a pleasure to see you.” “Hi Bertha. I had some free time and decided to come see you.” “Well ain’t that just sweet. You think you can come over here and let me see your little partner?” Serene walked over to the counter and set you down on it. Bertha looked you all over and showed extreme signs of adoration and curiosity. “Ain’t you just the cutest thing I’ve ever seen. Hank, get out here and see the human.” “No. I am just as happy back here sticking to my work.” “Don’t mind him. He’s just paranoid bout humans. I don’t know why. Now let me get you something for coming round to see me.”

You looked up at the wall and noticed flavors marked in chalk on what appeared to be a blackboard, but they were all were based on berries. “So what can I get you two?” “How about Hondew?” “I’ll get that for you, free of course.” “Thanks Bertha.” Bertha went to a back room and after a few moments, came back with an orange colored drink. “I’d love to sit and chat, but I’ve got other things to take care of. Enjoy it and maybe I’ll see you both another time.” Bertha handed the drink over to Serene and headed to the back room again. Serene sat down at a table and took a little sip. Serene poured a little onto the table just so you could get a taste. You put your hands together and drank it from your hands. But you quickly froze after it had hit your mouth. You recognized this pain in your head as brain freeze and the drink as a slushy. The flavor however was good, but as you looked over to Serene the glass only had a little of the pink substance left. But you weren’t sure what was going on for a second. The full glass had just hit the bottom and barely any time had passed. Also something else didn’t seem right, but you couldn’t put your finger on it.

“Well let’s get going since you’re not going to have any.” Serene said in a disappointed tone. You weren’t sure why she sounded the way she did, but you went along with it. After what felt like hours, she arrived at home and went straight to her room. She set you down on the desk and went to her bed. You went into the house and booted up the computer. After typing the report on how the day went, a response was sent with an attachment. “Roy we have recently established multiple channels of acquaintances which you may be able to speak to at your leisure.” You opened the list and organized the names on your desktop. A voice yelled up the stairs, “Serene, it’s time to eat.” Serene stood outside the house, sat the school newspaper outside the house and looked in. “Well come on. Let’s go grab a bite to eat before it’s all gone. “Um Serene, is it alright if I don’t eat? I just got a list of people from back home who I’d like to talk to and if I talk to them now, we have more time for us to talk later.” “That sounds like a great idea. I’ll see if I can bring the food up here.”

You made yourself my size and we slept that way.” She giggled. “You sure are silly. I think you ate too many of those spicy Wonder Bites last night.” She set you down on the floor next to your bathroom and she walked to hers.

You got in and showered up, but got lost deep in thought. ‘We did sleep at the same size, right? We had to have. I mean she did want to see what it was like and I did say she was a great guardian. I’m not going crazy am I?’ You finished the shower and got dressed. After Serene came to get you and brought you downstairs. They kept walking until they arrived at a small room labeled Teachers Lounge. Everyone took a seat, with the three legends sitting across from Serene. “Now that everyone we need is here, let’s begin. First off, Roy, I am Entei, to my right is Suicune, and to my left is Raikou. We, as you probably already have figured out, are part of the government of this world. As such, we will be the ones who will be supervising you today and if necessary in the future, the ones who you may contact if you need assistance or to speak with someone of higher authority. I will be with Mrs. Blaze discussing policies and things enforced throughout the school. Raikou will be walking through every other room and inspecting the safety. Suicune will be following you and Ms. Variform around to survey you personally. Do you have any questions?” No one spoke a word. “Very well. Let’s get started then, shall we?”

Everyone stood up and departed for their specific locations. However, along with Suicune came Raikou who in fact passed Serene and came around to her front. “Ms. Variform, would you guide me to your classes so that I may inspect them first?” Serene complied and showed him all the classes and afterwards returned to Mr. Shartney’s classroom. She was going to take her seat, but Suicune asked her to move to the back corner.

“Sit back here. That way we’re out of the way of the class and we can talk if need be. So can I assume that you two are going out with each other?” “Yes we are.” “Well that’s a sign that you two get along well with each other. How are things at home Serene?” “They’re good and safe, but why are you calling me Serene and not Ms. Variform?” “We try to be informal whenever possible. However we have to be professional most of the time.” After a few more minutes of conversing, the class started to fill with students. The class started and Mr. Shartney gave his lecture, but he was more cautioned with his words than usual. The class passed quickly and Serene stood up and left, with Suicune following behind.

Walking through the halls was quite the spectacle because everyone watched Suicune and the students were splitting like a knife through butter. Serene arrived at Battle Applications class and sat along the wall. She set you on the ground and Suicune stood beside where she sat. Eventually Mrs. Taoshen began the class and started organizing battles. You started to get the pains again and sat down yourself, just about the same time Serene was called to have a double battle with Alana against Jake and Blake. Suicune sat down and scooped you in her hands. She was sitting with her knees up and set you on one of her knees. “Okay Roy. Now we need to talk alone. Has anything bad happened to you while in Serene’s protection?” “Uh n-no” “Roy you have to be completely honest with me right now. We need to make sure that nothing happens with you.” “No nothing has happened.” “Okay. Do you like being with Serene? If you don’t like being with her, we can get you someone else.” “No I like Serene so far. She’s very protective and kind.” “Have you had any pains or aches that come out of the blue?” “Yes.” “You have?” “Yes.”

Suicune’s face partially lost its calm composure and she picked you off her knee, then walked out of the room after telling Mrs. Taoshen to send Serene when she finished. Suicune held you in cupped hands as she walked into Mrs. Blaze’s office to which Entei swiftly turned around. “What seems to be the problem?” He questioned. “Roy seems to be suffering as Palkia thought he might. I’m going to take him out to see him, then go and get Ms. Variform.” “Okay.” Entei answered. Suicune walked out and you started to panic a bit. “Is everything okay?” You asked. “Everything should be fine since we’ve found this out now. Just be patient and let Palkia answer your questions.”

She went outside and there sat Palkia. “Ah Suicune. I see you have Roy in your hands. I assume that means…” “Yes.” “Okay. Hand him over to me and go fetch Serene.” “I will.” Suicune took off after a few minutes brought back Serene. Palkia handed you to Serene. “Is everything alright, Mr. Palkia?” “Please just call me Palkia. To answer question though, no. However right now the danger is not severe.” “What’s the problem?” Palkia seemed to collect his thoughts before he answered. “Well Roy right now has been suffering from what I call Transdimensionalism. Basically, his coming here has created a ripple in space and time, which has been causing him some pains. Just as well he may not truly be here.” “What do you mean by that? And what’s causing these ripples?” “Roy isn’t from our planet and coming from his world has created some ripples which distort the fabrics of time and space. Due to his small size though, while he most certainly feels them, we don’t notice them at all. Back to what I said about not being here, the effects of these ripples are time not moving at the proper rate and him jumping between dimensions.” “What? Can you explain that for me please? I’m not understanding it.”

“Of course I can. It’s not an easy concept to grasp. Basically a ripple in time causes time to move improperly. For example, a second for us may be a day for him or one year for us might only be seconds for him. Dimensionally, he moves between worlds exactly the same as this one but with minor changes, and he does this without even noticing he has.” “How many different dimensions can he go through?” “I don’t know. It could be as few as two or over nine thousand. However, I can solve all these problems, but..."

With all the problems going, what actually happened? Also with the time distortions, what has already happened and what was yet to come? You felt a certain hopelessness creep over you. You returned to your room and slept the day away, trying to rid yourself of the sorrowed thoughts.

“Roy? Roy, are you there? Roy!?” You mumbled sounds as you woke up and looked around
and saw the familiar portal with Palkia’s voice emanating from it. You got up and in a groggy state, stumbled into the portal. Upon ending up in Serene’s world, you landed in her hands and fell over from a lack of balance. “There you are. Now that everyone is here, let’s get things in order.” Palkia stood beside Dialga along with Mrs. Blaze, Raikou, Entei, and Suicune. Palkia and Dialga went into the teacher’s lounge. Serene and Mrs. Blaze sat on one side and everyone else was on the other.

“Okay we’ll try to make this quick. We’ve all go to things to do. Let’s start with the school’s status, then move on from there.” Dialga finished and looked down to Entei. “The school’s policies are in order. They apply well to all students.” Entei finished and Raikou started afterwards.

“The teaching staff does seem to acknowledge Roy as a student and accept him. Despite a few accounts of prejudice towards humans, they should not endanger either Roy or his education. As for the classrooms, there were some concerns concerning the upper level science classes as well as the kitchen and battle-type classes. However as long as Mrs. Variform does as she should and cares for Roy, all will be well”.

“As for the two personally, they most certainly work well together and show great care for each other. The participation in classes could not be completely observed, but from what I saw, he did pay attention. I will have to return at a later date.” “Very well Suicune. Come back the beginning of next week. Everyone dismissed.” Everyone got up and as Serene stood up, Palkia made a gesture for her to sit down and she did. “Sorry, but you can’t leave just yet. We still must discuss a few things.”

“To begin with, Roy, are you feeling well?” “Uh Yes.” “How good?” “About how I felt back in my world.” “Excellent. Dialga and I worked to the best we could without causing damage to everyone else. However, all of us leaders decided that for the next three school days, you will have some changes just to check that all is well. For example, you won’t be coming to school tomorrow, just to make sure if there are any additional problems they are just with you. The following day Serene will match her size to yours and you both will be traveling with someone else. Suicune will be observing you both as of Monday of next week.”

After that Palkia asked questions regarding your experiences and such relating to transdimensionalism. After he was done asking about that, he started talking about the effects of it. “So, I think I need to finish my explanation. However I think you both should ask me questions rather than me ramble on.” Serene immediately shot a question out. “So if he has been to multiple dimensions, why does he act normal as if he has been in one place the whole time?” “Because he crosses dimensions that are almost perfectly aligned. For example, if you took a bite out of a sandwich right now and he changed dimensions, the changes wouldn’t be always easily noticeable. You might have taken a smaller bite or bit in a different place or maybe even taken more than one bite. I’m sure there have been more significant changes but he probably ignored them or didn’t notice them.”

“So if that happens, how does it affect him?” “Well it really screws with his mind. He may remember things from a different dimension that did not happen here or just the opposite. He may know and experienced things that are yet to come or he may have forgotten all that happened mere seconds ago. Like with these pains he may experience them the first time but is sure he has had them before, which is why you both need to pay the most attention to the fine details from now on. Also I think it is best if you both check what has and hasn’t happened so far, for the sake of Roy’s sanity.”

Serene gave a puzzled look.” “Why can’t you ask Mr. Dialga to send him back to when he first came here so he knows it all?” “Because we don’t want to mess with the fabrics of time or space too much for now. It is safer and quicker if you just fill him in. Do either of you have any other questions?” Neither of you said a word. “Very well then. You both may go home now.” Both you and Serene said farewell and she walked home.

Serene walked into her room and set you down outside the model house. She shrank herself to your size and walked in with you into the house. “So where do you wanna start?” Serene asked as she sat on the floor beside where you had decided to sit. “I don’t really know. And since I don’t know where to start, I guess we have to go back to the beginning.” You said as you buried your face in your palm.

“What’s the matter with you? You’ve felt different since you got back.” You took a gentle breath. “I’ve just been thinking about all that’s been happening and realizing for all I know, I’ve been living a lie. I guess… it’s just a feeling of hopelessness.” She looked you in the face. “Maybe, but let’s read a little further into the book before we close it and toss it away.” You stood up and helped her up. “I don’t know what I would do without you.” She turned away with red cheeks.

You powered up your laptop, sent a quick summary to your government and started writing down events in the order they happened. “What are you doing?” Serene asked as you sat down once again. “Writing all the things that have happened since I’ve gotten here. That way, when I have them all written, you can go through the list and say what didn’t happen.” Serene just wrapped her arms around you. “I love you so much Roy.” You stopped typing to give her a kiss. “I know. Otherwise you wouldn’t take such good care of me. I love you too Serene.”

You finished the list and handed the computer to Serene. She opened a side column and started writing in her own things, some of which she gasped and took a moment before she started writing again. Finally she handed the laptop back to you. You gaze at it and that sense of hopelessness floods over you again. Over half the things you had experienced did not happen here. Mr. Necroen did not get his way and you were to stay with Serene through homeroom as well as remain in standard apparel. The throwing test never happened due to safety conditions. Many other things were different, but the one that caught your attention the most was with Serene’s brothers. Rather than just threatening you, they carried out their actions and your mind went mad, because you couldn’t believe how intense it must’ve actually felt.

Your head fell back against the wall. You were basically dead: motionless, breathless and speechless. The hopelessness had overcome you. Serene cuddled up to you and tried to comfort you. Shortly afterwards, Matt walked in through the open door and called for Serene. She walked out and whispered to Matt outside the house. You couldn’t hear what they were saying, but it what did it matter? It probably was talk about you or something the past few days. Matt set a plate of food outside the house and left.

You grabbed a bite to eat and sat in the house. “Serene, I’m not saying this because of you or something you’ve done, but I’m going to sleep here tonight. I love you.” She walked in and gave you a hug. “Love you too. Things will get better. Just wait.” She walked out and after returning to her normal size, laid in her bed. You got in some lounging clothes, put down some of your thicker clothing like a bed and tried to get comfortable. “Yeah maybe.”

11521112221212111222112221.content:
You rolled around on the floor of the model house and propped yourself up on your arms. You got up, stretched, and looked to Serene’s bed, but saw it empty. However through the door walked Ashley and she looked into the house. “Roy, are you in there?” She whispered, while scanning the house’s interior with one eye.

“I’m right here” You say, walking a little closer. “Okay, well get ready. Serene’s not herself today, so I think I’ll take you, if that’s okay with you.” “Well, I’m not going to school today, under Palkia and Dialga’s orders. But what’s wrong with Serene?” “Well. Um…”

Ashley gets cut off as Serene crouches to get through the door and she immediately starts yelling at Ashley, screaming for no apparent reason, like the Serene you had met faded and was replaced by this larger Espeon. You retreated back into the house and watched as Serene almost threw Ashley out of her room. You then watched as Serene smacked her brothers around and yelled at all of them, again for no reason. You waited until every member of the family, including her parents, had left.

You headed to the bathroom, and afterwards you scrambled back up the desk. You opened your computer and went out to the window to let it charge, since it ran on solar power and you hadn’t used it too much or charged it since you arrived. In the process of letting it charge, two separate chat rooms sessions were requested. One of them was the government demanding a better description of the past few day’s events and the other was Morgan Karlyle, your eighth grade girlfriend.

You went on talking between the two, but neither one was pleasant, with the government yelling “I don’t know” is not a valid answer to why can’t you better explain what has happened and Morgan wanting to go back out with you, even though when you both went out, she paid you no mind.

After a half hour of frustration and irritation, you took the battery out of your computer, put it back in, and left the computer to charge on the windowsill. You ran your fingers through your hair and took a deep breath. You went from the window to your house, and from there you climbed up to the roof. You laid down and calmed yourself, taking slow breaths and not thinking a thing.

Eventually the time came for lunch and you felt pretty calm, so you slid off the roof and landed smoothly on the desk. You then slid to the floor and that’s when the scale of this operation. All the area you had to cover and those stairs, not to mention if you could get to the food. You climbed back up the desk and searched through your bags for a little tool you seriously thought about not bringing, but decided in the end it was probably better to have it: A complete multi-tool.

You once at the stairs. After a few minutes you stood atop the beginning step and looked down. Even with the carpet, the fall was too great and there was no form of rope in this world. You look up and see the hand rail. Seeing it as no more than a giant slide, you climb one of the vertical bars and maneuver over the rail itself. After lining up as best as you could, you slide down the railing and when the time came you needed to slow down, you forced your feet onto the railing. You ended up near the end and slid down the bar there. The bar reached the floor and you started walking towards the kitchen.

After quite a few minutes, you reached the kitchen. You walk over to a counter and climb it. Once on top of the counter, you notice a shred of something blue. Upon closer examination, you realize that this thing was part of some berry, but in proportion, was probably a mere crumb. You tried to take bite, but the berry was a bit too firm to merely nibble off of. After checking around to make sure there was nothing simpler, you went back to the berry and flipped out the knife.

Every little bit tasted delicious despite its tough form. After climbing down, you walk back to the stairs. You took a deep breath and headed toward the steps. You grabbed the fiber of the carpet steps and slowly climbed up.

After quite a climb, you reached the top and walked into Serene’s room. You checked the time and realized it took two and a half hours to go down and back. You tottered into the house and laid down, feeling exhausted from the adventure.

The next thing you knew, you were awoken. You mumbled words that were impossible to comprehend, but the angry tone was easily understood. “Come on. We got stuff to do.” You roll over and see Matt through the window hole. “What’s this stuff that needs to be done that requires my presence?” “Would you quit screwing around and come on?! We can’t keep Mr. Arceus waiting!”

You were filled with curiosity. Why would Arceus show up here? Why was Matt in such a rush? Why was he acting like you should know all of this? You climbed on his hand and waited for the answers to all this.

Eventually you went downstairs and in what could be called the dining area. On one side of the table sat Arceus and Mew. On the other side sat Andrew and Greg.

“Ahh. Mr. Roy, what a pleasure to meet you in person.” Matt set you down and you walked a little closer. Giving a bow, you said “As it is a great pleasure to meet the both of you.” Mew whispered to Arceus, and he shook his head. “Not right now, my dear. We have business to attend to first.” Mew looked a little disappointed.

“Um Arceus, if I may speak please, I have a question.” “Go ahead.” “Pardon me, but I have no idea as to why we are gathered here.” “Hm is it that you were not informed or is it your condition?” “I would believe it is my condition. These three act as though I were informed.” Greg lowered his head and whispered words in angry, yet silent tone. “Ah but Greg he’s done and experienced things you haven’t. I suggest you watch your tongue before I find a way to silence it.” Greg recoiled and lowered his head.

“Roy, I believe Palkia advised you to take time and divide the false from the truth. Did you accept his advice?” “I did, and I understand the basics of the past events. However, some details have been lost.” “That is understandable. I arranged to discuss tonight the severity of Andrew’s, Greg’s and Matt’s actions, as well as a suitable punishment.”

Arceus then went over the entire event and described it in more detail than Serene had. You listened to Arceus with deep focus. Then he finished and looked at you. “So, Roy, what do you feel is a worthy punishment?” You sat and thought for a few brief moments.

“I believe there should be no punishment.” Everyone reacted with shock. “If I may ask Roy, what would cause you to make such a statement?” “You do not need my permission to ask a question. You are greater than I. My reasoning is simple, yet complex. What I suffered was not in this dimension, so to punish them for that is not just because they did not do that. To punish them for what truly happened cannot be done because I have no recollection whatsoever, as if it never happened. Thus I believe they can’t be punished.”

Arceus meditated on your reasoning for a little while before responding. “I accept your reasoning, even if it is odd. Roy has spoken and no punishment shall be given. I ask that you three leave this room for a moment.” They all obeyed and fled upstairs. “Yes, that is better. Now we may speak alone. I assume your stay here has been pleasant.” “What I experienced it has, even if it my experience does not exist here.” “I apologize for such a predicament. Had we known, we most certainly would have stopped it early.” “I understand. I don’t think it could have been stopped even if time were put back to that first day.” “Perhaps you are right. I am glad that you were chosen as the human that was to be sent over.”

Mew started nudging at Arceus and gave him longing eyes. He sighed. “Roy may I introduce my wife, Mew.” You gave her a bow and after smiling back, enclosed you in a bubble. She giggled and after Arceus gave her a dirty look, she lowered the bubble to the table and made it pop. After a bit more conversation, Arceus and Mew decided they should leave. “To you three brothers, I suggest you give Roy the utmost care and respect, because next time, not even him and his mercy will be able to spare you.” With that Arceus and Mew walked out the door.

As you were sitting on the table, a little surprise coursed through you at Arceus’s words. Slowly Andrew, Greg, and Matt walked up the stairs. “Hey there. Nice guy Arceus is.” “You mind if we have a talk with you, in the basement?” You gave a face of resentment. “Isn’t that what you said the last time, and isn’t that how this whole thing started.” “Okay sorry. We promise not to harm you.” “And you told Serene you weren’t going to hurt me the first time around either if I am correct.” All three looked away and had a defeated expression they wore. You sighed and took a minute to think.

“I don’t hate you guys. I really don’t but now that I realize you went farther than what I saw, I need to be cautious. And Arceus was right by saying to watch your actions. If anything goes wrong from now on, the sole option may be to take me away from Serene, no matter if it’s aggressive or not. I would be hurt and you know she would be destroyed inside. So here’s your chance to make it up. Let’s go downstairs.”

They took you downstairs and you instantly noticed the relaxing atmosphere. They set you on Andrew’s desk and began questioning all about your “condition”. You explained it all and made them understand it. It had grown so late that you decided to sleep on Andrew’s desk rather than risking it with Serene. So on that hard wood grain, you curled up and fell asleep.

115211122212121112221122211.content:
You tossed and turned, but your movements were partially delayed. You struggled to prop yourself up, but instantly recognized you weren’t on Andrew’s desk anymore. Rather you were on a bed and looked to see Serene’s desk. You looked around and noticed no sign of Serene.

But that doesn’t mean she wasn’t there, for at that moment she, at your size, cuddled up with you from behind. You tried to break loose, but she had a tight grip. “Why are you trying break free?” “Cause I wanna know what happened yesterday before I settle in with you.” “It doesn’t matter. I’m back to normal and that’s all that matters.” “Serene, it does matter. What happened to you?” “No it really was nothing.” “Serene…” “I mean it. Just forget abo-.” “SERENE!” Her grip became weak and her arms felt limp.

You relaxed and let out a deep sigh. You then rolled over and looked her in the eyes. “Serene, I’m sorry. I really am. But I need to know what happened, and no excuse is going to make me stop asking.” She turned a light red and broke eye contact. “But it’s… personal.” You took a moment to think of what to say. “Serene, what am I?” “Um… My boyfriend, a student, a human?” “There, the last one. A human. And what are humans known for here?” She didn’t answer. “You know the answer. You have embarrassment. I have shame. Could you please tell me now?”

She nodded and whispered in your ear. “I was on my period.” “You were embarrassed to tell me that?” “Why do you act like that?” You wrapped her in your arms. “You have no control over that, so you shouldn’t be embarrassed. Besides I learned all about that this summer, just with human women.” “You learned that already?!” “Serene let’s be honest. I’m about the size of one of your teeth. Don’t you think it may important that I know all about the body before I deal with one as big as yours?” She just nodded.

You stood up and as she was about to, you picked her up in your arms. She seemed a bit surprised, but nonetheless enjoyed it. You gave her a kiss, set her down and made your way to the bathroom while downstairs someone had just come inside the house. You were in the middle of showering when someone started talking to Serene, but you couldn’t tell who because of the water.

You finished up and after stepping out into the open, you saw it was Vienna. You waved as you started to climb up Serene’s desk. Vienna set Serene down and Serene came in just as you were putting on your shirt. “Come on Roy. Vienna is waiting for you.”

You and Serene climbed onto Vienna’s hand. “So how do I carry you both?” Vienna questioned before she even moved a step. “Well, I usually have Roy either on my shoulder or on the top of my head. Where do you want to be?” You weren’t sure where was better. “I guess let’s take the top of your head. We can see everything up there and we’re out your way Vienna.”

“But aren’t you afraid of falling off and … dying?” “Vienna, we’ll be fine. Serene picked you because she believes in you. I believe in her and you. Besides, Dialga would make sure that would never happen. Trust me. But before we go up top, could we go grab some food? I’m really hungry and I got no food last night.” “Of course. But did you eat lunch yesterday?” “Yes. After going into the kitchen, I found some remnants on the counter.” “How long did it take you?” Serene asks. “Around two and a half hours. It was climb up that took so much time.” “Well, let’s get going then.”

Vienna coupled one hand over the other, trapping you and Serene between her palms. “She’s pretty nervous, isn’t she?” You whisper to Serene. “I pulled it on her just this morning. I really wasn’t in an asking mood yesterday and… it’s a long story. Besides she’s worried about her abilities, because you’re so small and delicate.” “Hm, she wasn’t this nervous a few days ago.” “What do you mean by that?” “It’s a long story. Longer than yours.”

Vienna’s hand moved away and she was now sitting at the table with the rest of Serene’s table. “Are you sure it’s alright if I eat with all of you? I don’t want to intrude.” “It’s okay Vienna. We don’t mind. Besides you’re keeping a seat from being empty and you’re taking care of our little girl.”

You tried to hold back the laughs. “What’s so funny?” Serene asked with a piercing eye. “I thought it was kind of punny, given the circumstances.” “You’ll always be my little man.” “And I wouldn’t want it any other way.” Everyone started to grab a little bit of food. Serene slowly walked toward the food on Vienna’s plate, head turning every direction possible.

“What’s the matter?” You asked Serene. “Well it’s just that, even though I’ve been small before, everything just looks so different this time.” “Well if you think this is different, wait until we’re on top of her head.” She eventually grabbed some food and ate with you. After a while, both of you stopped. “It’s so weird saying this,” Serene uttered, “but I can’t finish half a glass of juice.” “It gets better, babe. You get a free ride, you can’t do any work, and you spend time around someone that’s pretty awesome. Usually it’s you, but in this case it’s Vienna.”

Vienna and everyone else got up and after saying some words, left to get to school. However, both you and Serene were back to being in Vienna’s hands. “Vienna, why are you aren’t letting us on top your head?” No response. You grumbled a bit. “VIENNA!!” She slowly lifted her hands so she could hear and see you. “Yes?” “Why aren’t we on your head?” “Well I just felt you both were better off in my hands. I can see you that way.” “Vienna, we’ll be fine. Just put us up there and that way you have two hands free.” “Sorry, but no.” With that she lowered you once again. You turned to Serene. “Why won’t she listen to me? I’m being nice and she does only have two hands, unless she’s somehow psychic.” “I think she’s just too afraid of if something goes wrong.”

Eventually Vienna arrived in her first class of the day. She sat down and set you two on the desk. As you looked ahead, you recognized the teacher as Mr. Lupinel. “So, am I right in assuming this is a writing course?” “Yes you are.”

“Okay. Well, I just want you to know that sometime during the class, I WILL end up on your head and by the end of the day we all WILL be perfectly fine.” “I really would rather you not. I don’t want anything to happen to you.” “Vienna, I’ve not fallen off Serene’s head yet, or at least I don’t think I have. I promise Serene and I will be fine. Just have faith.”

About that time Mr. Lupinel starting walking towards Vienna. “Vienna, may I ask with whom you are talking to?” “Roy and Serene, sir.” “Really?” He crept closer and took a close look at you and Serene. “Indeed it is. Good to see you both again. Did you drop by for a little literature lesson?” You chuckled and Serene shook her head. “You could say that. So what are we learning today?” “I never told you when you were in the class so you would not try to get too far ahead. It shall be the same now.”

He returned to the front and continued whatever he was doing up there. A few minutes later and after all the kids had poured into the class, the bell rang. Mr. Lupinel then began the class.

You then analyzed Vienna’s fur and amount of focus. You went over by Serene and whispered your plan of climbing Vienna. Although she didn’t want to go against her friend’s decision, she went with it, hoping it was for the better. You both reached the top of Vienna’s head with no trouble. After reaching the top, you thanked Serene for going along with you and she met you with a hug.

You stood up and after moving close to one of Vienna’s ears, you playfully said to Serene “Well we made it to the top of Vienna. It looks I’m king of the Ninetales and you’re my queen.” After giving a second for Vienna to react, you spoke once again. “I’m kidding Vienna. I never would want to rule over anyone and I think same is true for anyone else.”

Eventually the class ended, but Vienna talked to you both a little before she got up. “Are you sure you both are alright up there?” “Don’t worry about us. We’ll be fine” You replied. “So if you do fall, what then?” You were about to say something when Serene cut in. “We have plenty of options. I can use my powers, we can aim for the top of your mouth or one of your tails.” “But what about the curse? Isn’t that a concern or what if you miss your goals?”

You gave Serene a look and you each headed over to an ear. You started scratching as hard as you could. Vienna obviously felt it based on her sudden loosening up. “Relax Vienna. Relax. Don’t think like that. If it comes to that we’ll take care of it. Until then, relax and let things happen.” Serene said with a very soothing voice. “OK then. But maybe you can scratch my ears more at lunch? That feels good and I am taking really good care of you both.” You and Serene chuckled. “Of course Vienna. Why couldn’t we?”

1152111222121211122211222112.content:
Vienna grabbed her tray of food and sat at the table where everyone was already eating. “Looks like it’s a good thing you had two hands” You whisper into Vienna’s ear. “Perhaps you were right. But the day is not over yet. So you still need to be cautious.” “Fair enough.” You say as Vienna took her seat.

Alana came storming over to the table with her tray of food. “Where is Serene on a day like today?” “Why’s that Alana?” Asked Stacey. “Because Jared’s back and he just knocked me over! If she was here, we could double team him.” “Do you want me to go after him?” Matthias asked in a chivalrous manner. “No. you’ve already got one foot in the fire and I don’t want you to have both in.” The two of them started to cuddle.

Serene was about to walk over to Alana when you stopped her. “Where are you going?” You ask. “I’m going to see Alana. Why do you ask?” You walked over to her. “Well I don’t think going over to see her like this would be the best idea.” Serene got a panicked look on her face. “Why not?” “Well, for one, she and everyone else at this table are not used to seeing you so tiny. Besides she’s cuddling with Matthias and probably can’t even hear your telepathy.”

“Oh.” Serene’s ears lowered slightly. You put your arm around her shoulder. “I know you’ re more durable than I am and more powerful. But I just care about you and you’re at my size so I feel I know a few things.” “But I’d like them to know I’m here without Vienna telling them.” You wandered around on Vienna’s head and noticed the food on her tray. She had a sandwich and some berries. You got an idea and ran over to one of Vienna’s ears. “Vienna do you mind if we play with your food a little bit?” “No I don’t care.” She blurted out as all the conversations stopped and everyone looked at her.

You assumed she felt embarrassed. “Sorry about that.” You whispered as you walked away. Serene stood amongst Vienna’s hair. “I never thought walking through hair could be such a challenge.” Serene said. “Well, if you women didn’t take such good care of it, it would be a lot worse.”

“Well I have a way that you can get everyone’s attention without the formal introduction.” You said. “And what does our lunch have to with it?” She inquired. “Well you see, since you’re psychic, I thought maybe you could move one of those berries around and… you know. Um, surprise them.” “I guess that could work. Even though I really want to just go up to their ears and surprise them that way.”

“You can, but I just don’t want you to get hurt. I guess I care too much.” “And that’s why I love you so much. Because you care about my wellbeing and not just my body. Although I can’t imagine what it’s like when I have to fight.” “You don’t know how much I want to run out there and stop the fight.”

“Well as much as I love my friends, I’m hungry and they need to know I’m here. So let’s have some fun.” Serene prepared her psychic movements. “You’re the one having fun. I can only watch and enjoy.”

She focused on one of the berries and pulled it from the bunch it was in. She adjusted her one hand and lifted the berry. You walked around and saw her actions. Her face was empty, her body had become lifeless, and she showed no signs of life except for the bold crimson of her eyes, minor fluctuations in the red gem on her forehead, and her hand movements. You wanted to look somewhere else, but your eyes were locked on hers. She’s used her abilities before, but her eyes never held such a tone. From such pools of gentle purple to these bloodied lakes, it was so haunting. Then she looked directly into your eyes. “What’s the matter?” She asked, with her face still showing no emotion.

You were paralyzed with fear. Fortunately at that moment, Rose’s voice shattered the awkwardness. “What’s with that berry? Why is it floating?” Everyone except Vienna scanned the entire lunchroom looking for the cause. “I’m not seeing anyone. You think Serene is here and this is her way of messing with us?” Stacey questioned. “No. I think it’s Vienna. She’s not even moved at all.” “Come on Cecilia. I’m not psychic. Besides whenever Serene does it, she moves her hands.” “But you’ve not said anything all lunch except for that blurt out earlier.” “Well, I’m hungry.” Vienna said.

Serene moved the berry around the table and eventually brought it from under the table to behind Vienna’s back and onto her head. You and Serene ate as much of the berry as you could. She eventually laid back and sighed. “I never thought I would say this but, I’m full off of half that berry.” “Tragic, isn’t it? Well it was good nonetheless.” Serene sat there a few minutes, apparently thinking. “We still need to reveal ourselves. But how?” You had an idea and whispered it into Serene’s ear. She smiled. “I’m not sure whether to like your creativity or fear it.” “Oh come on. These are harmless pranks. If you’re afraid of this, you’ll have nightmares when I really cause trouble.”

She levitated you high into the air and moved you completely above Cecilia’s head. Serene lowered you carefully onto her head. She didn’t notice and you walked over to near where her ear was. In the deepest and strangest voice you could come up. “Be cautious of those you throw in the ring of fire. You shall be next.” You mentally told Serene you were ready for the final act. She got the message and lifted you off the table. But instead of bringing you back to Vienna’s head, she set you in the middle of the table.

You didn’t look at Serene, but you weren’t too happy because she decided to throw you under the bus. You froze as all eyes focused on you. “ROY?!” “Yeah, it’s me. What’s goin on?” “Were you the one moving that Bluk berry?” Rose inquired. “Of course. I wasn’t here yesterday, so I decided to come back in style.” “Since when are humans psychic?” Cecilia asked with a glare. “Nobody ever has proven humans aren’t psychic. But nobody can prove it either. So it’s based on the individual.” “Sure. So how about some evidence.” Cecilia muttered.

You closed your eyes and concentrated, trying to find something you could do. That’s when you remembered the perfect line that could come in handy. “Well for instance, Cecilia, the past days you’ve been wanting to call me Comran due to the fact that I am from another world, searching for love.” Everyone froze and stared. Cecilia by far was utterly paralyzed. “S-serene told you, didn’t she?” “No she actually has no clue about that. And for evidence I will make her appear at my size so you can ask her.”

You turned to face Vienna and raised your hand and slowly brought it down. Vienna slowly moved her head down to match your movements. Serene, unable to keep her stance, falls onto Vienna’s hand. You raised your hands high and walked in a circle. Serene, realizing what just happened, ran at full force and jumped in a pounce movement. But you side stepped and caught her in your arms.

“You’re no fun.” Serene said in a playful tone. “You threw me under the bus first and I didn’t want to go alone. Besides you know you wanted a good way to reveal yourself. This way was pretty good, I think.” Cecilia cut in. “So Serene, did you tell Roy about Comran?” Serene looked her in the eyes. “No. He knew that all on his own.” Cecilia remained frozen.

Serene then turned to face Alana. “So do you still want to go after Jared?” Alana shook her head. “I think we’ll put that appointment off for another day.” Serene giggled.


The bell then rang for lunch to end. You carried Serene over to Vienna and after climbing atop her hand, Vienna set you on her head. “That was impressive Roy. If Serene didn’t want you, I’d take a swing at you.” You were a bit taken back at first, but then realized what she meant. “I hope you mean that in like a ‘want to date you’ way.” You said into Vienna’s ear. “Of course. Why? Is there a different meaning?” “Yes. In the human world, to take a swing at some usually refers to that you’re going to punch them.” “Oh my.”

“Yep. Just violent ole’ humans.” You said as you laid back against her ear. Serene came and sat right next you. “I really like you Roy. You’re more fun than I thought and you’re even nicer. I’m glad we were paired up.” You wrapped your arm around her shoulder. “Serene, I’m glad you like me. And I just want you to know, that you’re the best woman ever. I’ve dealt with a lot of females back home and not one could compare to you. I’m glad you like me so much, even if I am not as attractive, nor powerful as you.”

You both were cuddling up when Vienna said, “Aww.”

Serene snapped her eyes open as the final bell rang. “Is it that time already?’ She asked. “Time flies when you sleep.” You said with a laugh. “I wasn’t sleeping!” She snapped back. “So then what is it called both eyes are closed and your breathing slows?” Serene said nothing, but Vienna cut in. “So am I just a slave and a bed to you both?” You laughed. “We respect you too much to be a slave and she was the one sleeping. Besides, I think saying you can sleep on someone is a sign of how soft and relaxing they are. A compliment really.”

“If you think so. Hey Serene, since we’ve got Roy here, can we go say hi to my family?” “Sure. I think we could.” “I’m glad I’m such a trophy.” “I would be overjoyed to be the center of attention.” Vienna said. “So would I.” muttered Serene “HA! Okay, I’ll go talk to Palkia, ask him to make you both proportional from my size to yours, and I’ll carry you back to the human world with me. Then we’ll see.”

Vienna came up to presumably her house, which conveniently was next to Serene’s. “So this is whose house this is. Cool.” You said with a grin. Vienna pushed the door open. “I’m home and I brought some friends.”

In walked an older female Ninetales. “I don’t see anyone. Are you sure they didn’t leave you on the way here?” “That’s terrible!” You cried. Serene leaned over. “Her mom tends to joke in ways that seem cold. But she doesn’t mean it.” “I would hope so.”

“Very funny mom.” Vienna said as she started walking towards her mom. “But honestly, where are they hun?” “I’m going to get a drink, then I’ll show you. Maybe by then, everyone else will be here.” At just the right moment, you took a deep breath and shouted “In a matter of speaking, we’re on her mind.” Vienna’s mom looked around in confusion.

Serene smacked you in the back of the head. “You sure are getting bold and harsh.” “It was a joke, Serene. If I really wanted to be mean, I would’ve. And you just smacked me. What’s going on with you?” “I-I don’t know. It just kind of happened.” “You better hope Arceus recognizes that as playful or affectionate. I don’t think I’ll be here much longer if he doesn’t, as seeing your brothers already lit that fire.”

Vienna grabbed her drink of water and headed back into the living room where her mother was sitting. “So here they are, mom.” Vienna pulled Serene from atop her head and set her on the floor. Serene resized herself and said hi to Vienna’s mother.

During their conversation, Vienna head arched back, sending you falling off the back of her head. You made quick decisions and grasped onto her hair. However her head quickly snapped forward as she let out an explosive sneeze. Her hair whipped forward and you found a way to guide yourself to her maw.

You stabilized yourself and looked around. You turned around noticed Vienna’s eyes were looking up while Serene seemed to be picking through her hair. “Have you found him yet?” Vienna asked with a scared tone. “No, but I’m sure he’s fine. He’s probably fine.” “But what if he fell into my tails? I don’t want him to be cursed because of me sneezing.”

“Who are you two talking about?” Vienna’s mother asked, absolutely clueless. “If we can find him, we’ll show you.” Serene said. “Thanks for believing me in, gorgeous.” You muttered, shaking your head. “Well, let’s get this show on the road. You walked on Vienna’s maw until you were at the flat of her face. You started pounding as hard as you could, but to no avail. “Pay attention when I’m pounding on your skull!” She couldn’t hear a word. You started making random sounds in frustration and sat down.

A few minutes passed and you got impatient. You walked to her nose and started drumming a rhythm on it. However you felt some vibration on it and notice her head lean slightly back. “Oh sh...” The sneeze shot from her nose with less power and more sound. Her hands captured you and all the snot that came with the sneeze. She took a look into her paws and did a double take. “Hey Serene. I found Roy.” “Wher… Oh.” “Are you okay?” Vienna asks, moving her ear close to you. “Can I please go wash your snot off?” “That sounds like a great idea.”

Vienna kept hands in one position and went back to the kitchen. She plucked you out and set you on the counter. She washed her hands off first and then set you in a part of the sink where there was a little pool of water. You scrubbed the snot off your clothes and shook the excess water. “Could you please give me a little flame to dry off?” She complied and put out the smallest bit of flame. You stood as close as you could stand and in seconds, not a single drip of water could be found.

Vienna carried you back into the room with Serene and Vienna’s mother. “Who is this person I’m wanting to see?” “Remember the human that was sent over here?” “Yeah. Wait, could it be…” “Yes it is.” Vienna’s mother gave a squeal like a young school girl.

The next hour you all talked and got to know each other. Vienna’s mother took an extreme interest in you and ‘your people’. Eventually Serene and you bid farewell and returned home. She went to her room and laid down on her bed, setting you in the valley of her chest. She yawned and you did the same. “So” You started, “Now what?” “Well. I was going to take a bath and was hoping you’d come with.” “Well… uh… If I did would have to wear some clothes so…” “Are you afraid to show off your body to me?” “Well no but, it’s strange to show your body off to anyone, especially fairly new people. I mean we’ve only physically known each other for about a week. I feel like that’s a bit um… forward if you catch my drift.” “Okay. Will you join me though?” “Yeah. Just let me get those clothes.”

Serene sent you over to the desk and you went in your home. You took off your jeans, socks, shoes and shirt. You grabbed a pair of shorts and went outside. Serene was standing outside, looking a bit surprised. “Half bare skin?” “It’s just my chest. Not like I’m giving you the entire show.” “That’s more than I expected.” You climbed onto Serene’s hand and went into the bathroom.

Serene set you on the sink as she went over and got the water running. She slowly lowered herself into the tub and let out a deep sigh. She looked over to you. “Sorry. I’m not used to bringing you in here with me.” You were surrounded in the pink aura and brought right above the water’s surface. She released you and you fell with a splash. You felt the temperature and feared how hot it would be, but the warmth was perfect.

115211122212121112221122211222.content:
You floated on the water’s surface, taking slow and relaxed breaths. It felt nice to have enough room to move, but the thought of diving eighty feet down to hit the bottom caused a little panic. But in a world built for those larger than life, everything should be ridiculously large.

“How are you doing, cutie?” Serene asked, looking as though she had fallen asleep. “I’m alright. I’m keeping my head above water. How are you doing, babe?” “I’m feeling great, especially since you joined me. I was afraid you were going to say no. But now I feel like I could split a sea.”

She started giggling and you noticed the water indeed seem to split. “You know, there was a time when this would surprise me, but no longer. So I’m going to keep floating and relaxing. You enjoy being stronger than any human.” “You make it sound like it’s a bad thing.” “No it’s a great thing. Especially since humans don’t have powers like that.” “So… I don’t mean to pry and I know what WE hear, but what was the human world like on a more personal level?”

You took a deep breath. “It’s all how you look at it. For me, I hated it. For others, it’s great. I guess it’s like this world just more intense.” “Like how?” “Well we all talk and interact, but in comparison, we were a bit more careless of others. The people who weren’t social like my dad usually had it the worst, with the suicide, depression and lack of friends. But if you had friends, you were usually fine.” “Suicide and depression, what are they?” Serene asked, eyes focused deeply on you.

“Well… Depression is some mental disease that makes you sadder than you should and suicide is the desire to want to kill oneself.” Serene sat up and looked real concerned. “Wait people want to kill themselves in your world?!” “Yep. My dad says he remembers when he experienced depression and both times he attempted suicide. Said those were years he never wants to relive again.” “Your dad did this ‘suicide’ thing?!” “Yeah. I don’t know much about it. He’d rather not talk about it. Guess I’m lucky he didn’t. Wouldn’t have gotten to meet you.”

“Are humans really cold enough to push each other so far to death? Do they not care?” “Well from what I’ve seen, it’s not a matter of not caring, but rather they just treat each other terribly until it’s too late. Although dad says things have improved since he was a kid. Now can we please switch topics? This is depressing and I’d really like to ask my questions.”

“Sorry. Go ahead.” “So you already took the literature course Vienna was in this morning. But how can you? I mean you and Vienna are the same age, aren’t you?” “Yes we are. But everyone has certain areas they exceed in, so they can take courses related to their skills. They say I’m a good writer, so I’m taking more advanced writing classes earlier. We’ll have writing class the next half of the year.”

“Really? So what you could theoretically do is write our story and publish it for the human world. Then people could hear our tale and you’d be even more famous.” “First off, what do you mean by our story? And why would I be more famous and not us both?” “Well the story of our love and coming together. No human really knows you like your friends know me. People would find it an interesting read. It would make some money.”

“I love you, but you’re sounding like one of those television agents. And I don’t know if I’d be willing to ‘sell our love’, if you understand what I’m saying.” “Yeah I do, nor do I blame you.” “Serene, Dinner’s on the table.” Called the voice of her mom. “Do you want to go get some food?” “It’s all up to you. I’m as hungry as you are.” “Then let’s stay here awhile.” Serene said, releasing her tensions. “Fine by me.” You say, following suit.

Time had passed and you were relaxed, except for the numbness coursing through your limbs. You swam to Serene and climbed up on her nose. “Serene.” No response. “Sereeeene?” Still nothing. “Serene! Serene! Serene! Serene! Hear my voice Serene! Please! I don’t want to have to hit you like Vienna.” She snapped back and sent you into the water. “What was that?!” You swam quickly back and sat upon Serene’s chest. “Y-you would start listening to me w-when I said that.” “You hit Vienna?” “I w-was trying t-to get her attention.” “What’s wrong? Why are you shivering?” “Serene, this water is cold.” “You could’ve just said you wanted to get out.” “I was trying, but you weren’t exactly all ears.” Serene patted in the water. “It’s not that cold.” “B-babe, don’t take this the wrong way, but if you weren’t so big, maybe you would feel the cold!”

“Okay then. Just because the water’s cold doesn’t mean you need to be.” “Sorry. But I am n-not in the mood for hypo-hypothermia, so if you could, I don’t know, keep me warm, that’d help a lot.” “Fine then. Let me do a quick dry off then so you’re not going into cold wet fur.” You climbed onto Serene’s nose and she stood up and shook her body slightly. She then went over to a corner of the room with a grate on the floor and held you between her hands so very little light came in. Then an unbelievably strong rush of air pounded her hands and moved them slightly. After a few moments, her hand that was over you moved away and revealed her now dry form.

“Okay let’s try this now.” She set you between her breasts, but in that valley was a sensational warmth. “That is much better. Thank you.” “So, what is this hypo-thing?” “Hypothermia is a problem humans get when exposed to cold temperatures for too long.” “Oh. And you are alright?” “Of course I am. I have you right here.” “So in the future, would you join me or would you rather not?” “I’ll still join you. I’ll just need to be more careful.”

“So there’s something I really noticed today and I want to know what you think.” “Yeah go ahead.” “Well, everyone seemed to be able to hear you, but theoretically they shouldn’t because of your size. Do you have any ideas?”

You took a moment to think about it. “Well, that’s something I’ve never given much thought to it. I accepted it and went with it. But since you brought it up, I guess my theory would be either your hearing is much better than what is believed, I’m louder than anyone believes, or possibly between Dialga and Palkia, some fibers were modified so that my voice and possibly other characteristics are enhanced for your senses. I’d be more willing to think the last one, but who knows. Now if I may ask, how long were we in the bath?” “Around a half hour.” “Ah, that explains why the water seemed cold.” “So are you hungry now?” “You would even bear to ask? I may be tiny, but food is always an option.” “If that’s what you wish, then we’re off.”

Serene made her way downstairs and went opened the fridge door with her free hand. The surge of air sent a chill over your body. “Tad bit chilly.” You said. “Maybe you should’ve switched clothes first.” “No! Food first, care later.” “Your recklessness concerns me. I feel like sometime you’re going to get hurt because of such carelessness.” “Sorry. I’m just hungry and besides food is just as important. Gives me energy so I can keep warmer longer.” “Okay then, cutie. Let’s eat.” Serene went to the table and set whatever the food was on the table. “Well here it is: A Tort salad.” “Oh.” “Is something wrong?” “No. I’m just thinking of how I miss the taste of meat.” “Sorry. No meat here. I wish I could help you.” You both began to eat and in walked Lily. “Hey sis, I heard there was a dance next week at your school and…” “And what?” Serene asked.

You looked into Lily’s eyes and knew what she was looking at. “Aw darnit. Should’ve listened to ya, Serene.” “Why’s that?” She asked. “Just wait,” you replied and in a voice that sounded hardly feminine said “Hey everybody, the top piece of the human’s clothes stuff is off!” in a matter of moments, with no commentary from Lily, the whole family had come in. “Are you kidding me!? This is freakin ridiculous! Try to be sarcastic and this happens. Serene, I give up.”

“Ah so the human is what caught your tongue.” Replied Mr. Variform. Everybody got closer and started to inspect your torso. “So is that what we would look like without our fur?” “I don’t know, son. That would be like asking with more hair, would he look like us.” “You groaned. “I don’t mean to be rude. I really don’t. But can the specimen return to consuming food or is the examination still in session?” Mrs. Variform spoke up. “Oh. We’re sorry. We may have gotten a little carried away. Let’s go everyone.” Everyone left, including Lily.

“That was a bit harsh.” Serene said emptily. “Yeah it was and I’m sorry it had to be. But I’m hungry, and everyone’s watching me like some science experiment. I’m sorry, but even for a human in a non-human world, that’s a bit ridiculous.” You exclaimed sternly.

You both finished eating and Serene looked at you. “So what now?” “I think maybe you should float me to the top of the stairs so I can meditate and calm down. I guess you can go talk to Lily and see what she wanted.” “Are you sure? I can…” “Babe, I’ve been completely cold tonight. I think I need to calm down before I say some other things I regret.” “Okay then. Be careful though.” “Of course.” Soon you were floating and at the doorway to her room.

You went into your bathroom and sat on the edge of the bathtub. Serene had come back a few minutes later. “Are you doing okay now?” “I’m better, but not good by any means. I think the best cure is sleep.” “With me?” “If you’re willing to have me. I need someone that can help thaw my cold heart.” “You’re not cold. You’re just having one of those nights.” “Yeah. Sure.” You went back to your house and changed into sleep attire, then with Serene’s help, slept in the crevice of her chest.

You climbed onto Serene’s gem and focused on it. You started to rub it, hoping for some effect. She moved slightly, but nothing major. You were still hanging onto her gem as she looked own to her family. “So either you don’t want me to sleep or Roy’s up. Which is it?” “I’m up here, babe.”

She grasped you with the familiar aura and set you down near everyone. “Hiding on me, are you?” “Well the on you part, yes. Hiding, not so much.” “Shame you didn’t sleep a little longer.” “Should’ve let you, but didn’t want to keep you waiting either.” “So if you wanted to sleep, why did you want him to wake you up?” Ashley asked. “I,” She paused to yawn “wanted to talk to him before you all played your games.” “So, we all come over here just to walk all the way back?” Matt asked with irritation in his voice. “You’re lucky I’m a good sister.” Serene said with a dead grin. Soon all of them had been moved over to the house. However rather than being near the entrance, they ended up on the roof.

“You must be tired: They’re all on the roof.” You said with a smile. “I am unbearably tired.” She said as her head fell towards you a bit. “You have to at least stay awake long enough to talk if that’s what you want. I don’t think you want a red stain on your forehead.” “I’m sorry. Never thought that they would’ve asked for that, and out of the blue nonetheless. Otherwise I would’ve done it through the night.” “You’d be just as tired because you wouldn’t have slept. So how are you doing other than being completely exhausted?”

She took a moment, apparently trying to organize her thoughts. “I’m okay. And how are you doing? Better than last night?” “Yeah. A little sleep goes a long ways.” “Lucky you.” “I’ll let you sleep and we can talk later. I’d rather you be happy talking than tired and confused.” “As tempting as that really is, I want to talk now. Then I can sleep better.” You sighed. “Whatever you want. So then what do you want to talk about?” You questioned as you sat down.

“Well, last night Lily reminded me that the high school is having a dance and the DJ is *yawn* one of my favorite music artists. So, will you go with me?” “Of course. I don’t have a problem with that, especially if he is a favorite of yours. But I do have one question. Does this dance have a formal atmosphere or is it like, relaxed?” “Um. I guess relaxed. It’s just a back to school dance. Why? Is it going to affect your coming with me?” “No. Just for personal knowledge. You’ll see why when there’s a formal dance. Now about today? What is going on?”

“Knew I should’ve told you last night. Every Saturday my family has a game night, where everybody gets together and plays a game or two. I guess though, all my siblings decided that they wanted to have some games or challenges with you personally. I don’t know why and I’m not even going to try to guess.” She finishes as her head slips a tad. “I’ll let you get back to sleep and see you when you wake up. Oh and in case I forgot, morning beautiful.” She mumbled something incomprehensible and her head fell into the pillow, sending a blast of wind your way. ‘Like I thought.’ You thought as you climbed down her bed and went over to the desk.

After you reached the desk’s surface, you looked up at everyone still sitting on the roof. “So what are we supposed to be doing?” “When we figure that out, we’ll let you know.” Andrew said. “Well I was thinking we get Serene to carry us to bathroom so we can start our fun.” Greg said as he jumped from the roof. “Go ahead if you want, but I doubt you’ll get very far. She’s out cold and I don’t think waking her up is a good idea, even if it does work.”

We’ll go into later.” Greg said. “So without further ado, let’s get started.”

“So how about we start with the sprint?” Matt said with some energy. “Sure. From here to the desk then?” “Let’s line you up first. Jeez.” Lily said as she made a line in the carpet. You and Matt lined up and waited for the signal. Greg gave a little burst of flame and the two of you took off. But you knew before either of you had taken a first step, he had the win and the distance between you proved it. He made the finish a few seconds before you. “Not the fastest thing there is, eh?” “Never was, and never will be? So what’s next?” “Let’s wait for them to catch up. I would guess Greg though.” Matt finished.

“So that’s one against you. Hope you aren’t that bad at everything.” Greg said after he made it to you and Matt. “Well then, Hot stuff, let’s see what you got.” “At the top of here. Greg felt weaker than you had imagined and although it took some effort to hold him, you could easily topple him. So you went for the win, and sure enough you had it. “Alright one more time.” So you two locked up again and you beat him once more.

“Yay! Go get it. Please!” “Yep. Be right back.” You climbed down the desk and after a few minutes, made it into Serene’s room.

You mindlessly walked down the hall, as your mind was distracted by curious thoughts. There was no doubt of Sarah being the artist of the family, but was she superior to you or equal? And how would the rest of the day proceed? And was a certain someone still out like a light?

You moved underneath Serene’s door and walked over to her desk. After climbing up, you looked at Serene while she was in her bed. She tossed and turned, and looked utterly restless. You went inside your house and switched into a pair of shorts and grabbed a towel, as you would be swimming later. After that, you searched through your things, looking for your sketchpad. You couldn’t find it in the bag, but realized it was lying on the ground. You picked it up and after reaching the edge of the desk, threw your sketchpad and towel on the floor then watched as they landed far below. You climbed down and after getting back to the carpet, retrieved your things.

You were walking to go back to Ashley’s room, when a voice said your name and looked to the bed. Serene was now half on and half off her bed and looking in your direction. “Roy, where are you going?” She asked. You walked closer to her bed. “I’m going back to Ashley’s room. I’m surprised you’re up.” “I’m fine. Let’s go” she said as she got up and tottered. You gave her a concerned glare. “I think you should go back to sleep.” “You’re silly. I’m perfectly rested. Now climb on.” Serene lowered her hand and swayed slightly. Against your better judgment, you climbed onto her open palm and she started off towards Ashley’s room.

Serene opened the door and noticed everyone on the desk. She set you down next to them and sat in Ashley’s desk chair. “I’m here. What’s the standings?” “Roy’s slower than Matt and stronger than Greg.” Lily said. “Not bad. Who is next?” Serene said as she yawned. “That would be Sarah. Could you get water in my sink just so it’s not ice cold when we’re ready to go?” “Yeah, sure.” Serene got up and went to the sink. She turned on both faucets and worked to get it perfect.

“I’m surprised she’s awake already. She didn’t mention any uh… burns, did she?” Greg asked. “She’s not mentioned anything other than how awake she is. But I have a feeling that won’t last long.” “Serene not knowing about the burn?” “No. I meant her being awake. You didn’t see her stumbling to get out of bed.”


Serene came back over and sat back down. “Not too hot and not too cold.” “Thanks. So are you two going to draw?” Ashley questioned. “Well I was thinking we could just compare. I don’t think there is such a thing as a better artist.” “So you wanted to compare and not compete? You don’t want to prove you’re better?” Matt asked. “Well no.” “You should show me your drawing, my little man.” Serene said looking at you as her head rested on the desk. “Let me find the page… Here.” You held up the page in front of Serene’s eye. She said nothing. “Uh Serene?” “You should show it to me.” She mumbled. You waved the book around, and then bopped it on her face a few times.

“I told you she wouldn’t be awake for long.” You said as you walked past Greg. “So what were you going to show her?” Sarah asked as she started walking over towards the edge of the desk. You followed and noticed that her sketch pad was laid out to a painting of Serene. “I feel like an idiot for not noticing that earlier. I’ll show you mine.”

You handed the pad to Sarah. She stopped to admire it, and her eyes moved in no other direction. “When and where did you this?” “Back home in my world. It was when we first sent each other pictures of ourselves. I figured whether she liked me or not, I’d draw her.” “It’s beautiful, and so realistic. I’ve never seen anything done like this. What did you do it with?” “Pastel chalk.” Everyone swarmed and admired it.

Minutes passed by and eventually everyone calmed down. “So what is this thing on your shoulder?” Lily asked. “It’s called a towel. It’s how I dry off when I get wet. Now since she has been waiting, I think Ashley is next on the list.” “Glad you think so. But there is a problem. We can get over to my sink easy, but what about you?” You looked at the sink and noticed it had an almost marble appearance. It was indeed going to be a challenge. “Well I’ll see you at the top, one way or another.”

You set your sketchpad down on the table and watched as everyone easily jumped the large gap between the sink and the desk. It was however too much for you to jump. You climbed down and went to the base of the sink. You attempted to climb the sink, but found its texture too smooth to get a solid grip on. So you looked around and noticed the water behind the sink. The pipes also had a more textured surface, and you worked on climbing up from there. You were near the top when the part of the sink stopped you from going up. You spent a few moments contemplating where to go from there. After a few slow but solid moves, you reached the flat of the sink. Everyone turned to look at you.

“We decided we’d give you a minute to catch your breath or prep yourself. Whatever you want to do, really.” Andrew said as he sat down. You looked at the makeshift pool that was to be the battleground. It was moderately deep, but not too bad. You leaned down and reached into the water. It wasn’t hot but it certainly wasn’t cold. You went to an open area of the sink and dropped your towel and removed your socks and shirt. Everyone’s attention suddenly focused on your bare chest.

“What? It’ll help me swim a little better and it’s not like you’ve never seen it before.” You said as you were stretching out. You then dove into the water and floated about for a few seconds. “So how is it?” Ashley asked. “It ain’t exactly nice, but it beats being cold. But why don’t you come on in and feel it for yourself.” She too took a dive, but dove to the bottom. She then shot from the bottom of the sink to the water’s surface and had enough momentum to soar a bit in the air. She swam over to the edge where you were resting. “Showoff” you said. “Well, shall we get started?” “Full down and back, right?” “Sounds fine to me” Ashley said as you both lined up as.

“Alright… Go!” Someone shouted. You shot off the wall and made strong strokes with your arms and legs. You didn’t know where Ashley was, but you really didn’t care. This was going to be a long swim whether you won or lost. It just felt good to go for a swim.

The realization that time had seized to exist came when you tapped the far wall. Ashley had apparently just tapped the wall and started her return towards the start. How you even caught up to her remained to be seen. You kept going, fighting the pain that consumed all your muscles. Eventually though you finished and floated around to catch your long-absent breath.

“So how far behind was I?” You asked. “You kept fairly close ‘til that last bit. You just lost anything you had at that point.” Lily said. “Oh well. Better than I would have expected. Well, hate to put things off, but I am going to float around and enjoy this water while it’s here.” You said as you floated on your back. “You don’t want to go again or see how deep you can dive?” Ashley asked within an obviously sarcastic tone. “Get me a tail and some way to breathe underwater, then we’ll talk.”

Everybody except Greg decided to get into the water. Ashley, not wanting to leave him out, gave him a shot of her own water, to which he did not respond well. The two started to shoot each other with whatever they had. In the process of hitting and missing, Greg’s flame warmed the water up a fair amount.


However, a shadow soon lurked over the water. You were very relaxed and didn’t even open your eyes to see who it was, because you already knew. “I was beginning to think you weren’t going to get up.” You said. “I do feel a lot better, although I’m not exactly sure what happened.” “Well, you passed out twice. That’s about all we can tell you.” Matt mentioned. Everyone started to climb out of the water. You got out and dried yourself off well before putting your shirt and socks back on. “So what’s next?” You decide to ask.

I think my gaze was scaring her so I decided to finally speak.

I could feel her heartbeat slow down gradually. "I'm sorry" I said. "I never should have asked you."

"No" Ivy replied. She dried any tears that were left and stopped the hug. Her purple irises were still glistening. "I should have told you about my family. You see, my family is adoptive.
